title: Paid Social & Performance Content Specialist
description:
Role Overview

The Paid Social & Performance Content Specialist creates, adapts and deploys high-quality creative that performs across TikTok Paid, Meta Paid, YouTube, Google (Demand Gen/YouTube/Display), Yelp 1P, DTC,
/SMS and third-party marketplaces.

We’re looking for a self-governing, fast, commercially minded creator who understands that creative is a core performance lever. You should be comfortable operating with minimal direction while staying aligned to brand guardrails, campaign priorities and performance feedback.

AI is central to the workflow, but human judgment, brand sensibility and final creative control always sit on top. This role sits inside the paid performance engine, where speed, consistency and quality matter as much as ideas.



What You’ll Do

Paid Strategy & Planning

Support execution of performance-driven paid creative strategy.

Maintain weekly/monthly creative calendars aligned to campaigns and launches.

Translate briefs from Paid Media, Ecommerce and Marketing into platform-ready creative for TikTok, Meta, YouTube, Google, Yelp 1P, DTC,
/SMS and marketplaces.

Propose creative angles, formats and tests based on performance trends.

Paid Creative Production

Produce platform-native assets including:

Short-form vertical video (TikTok, Reels, Shorts)

Mid-form YouTube creative

Static images and carousels

UGC-style performance video

Write conversion-oriented hooks, captions and CTAs.

Optimize creative for pacing, framing, text density and platform best practices.

Ensure all work meets brand standards while feeling native to each channel.

AI-Powered Workflow

Use AI tools for hook generation, A/B testing, video editing, thumbnail/caption variants and rapid iteration at scale.

Balance efficiency with brand integrity, treating AI as a production amplifier, not the decision maker.

Publishing, QA & Alignment

Prepare assets to exact specs for Meta, TikTok, YouTube, Google, Yelp and marketplaces.

Partner closely with Paid Media teams/agencies for smooth implementation.

Maintain organized asset libraries and clear naming conventions.

Ecommerce & Marketplace Integration

Design creative that supports conversion and product discovery.

Align timing and messaging with DTC promotions, paid campaigns,
/SMS and marketplace initiatives.

Ensure marketplace assets meet platform requirements while preserving brand consistency.

Performance & Learning

Review results including CTR, CPC, CPA, CPV, hook rate, watch time and view-through signals.

Refine storytelling, structure and hooks based on data.

Share concise creative learnings with stakeholders.

Collaboration & Trends

Work cross-functionally with Paid Media, Ecommerce, Marketing and Creative teams.

Stay current on platform updates and ad best practices across Meta, TikTok, YouTube, Google and Yelp.



You Bring

2–5 years experience in paid social creative, performance content, or ecommerce marketing.

Proven track record of high-performing short-form video and static paid assets.

Experience working with paid teams or agencies preferred.

Familiarity with YouTube and Google ad formats a strong plus.

Comfort owning workflows and deliverables with minimal supervision.

Working knowledge of CTR, CPC, CPA, CPV and hook rate.

Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

A portfolio demonstrating TikTok, Meta, YouTube and ecommerce-oriented paid creative is required.

Tools

Native ad tools across Meta, TikTok, Google, YouTube and Yelp.

Canva, CapCut, Adobe Creative Suite, or equivalent.

Hands-on experience with AI creative tools for variation and testing.

Ability to build scalable, repeatable creative workflows.

What Success Looks Like

Consistent delivery of high-quality, campaign-ready creative.

Reliable, on-time handoffs to Paid Media teams.

Improving creative efficiency and performance over time.

Clear contribution to paid-driven traffic and revenue across TikTok, Meta, YouTube, Google and Yelp 1P.

title: Customer Service Representative with Property Management Experience
description:

The Nabo Group is looking for 3 Customer Service Representatives with Property Management experience for our growing team, who enjoys solving problems, responsible, organized, detail oriented, and reliable to join our fun/hard working team. You must have excellent communication skills.

title: Client Support Representative
description:
Position Summary

We’re seeking a dependable, articulate Customer Support Representative to manage inbound calls from clients and prospective customers. You’ll handle inquiries, guide leads through our internal systems, and ensure every caller receives a professional, positive experience. This role requires someone who is tech-savvy, calm under pressure, and comfortable working flexible or rotating shifts.



Main Responsibilities

 – Respond to inbound calls with a warm, confident, and professional manner

 – Follow set scripts while accurately recording caller details in the CRM

 – Schedule jobs promptly based on customer needs, prioritizing urgent and emergency requests

 – Adapt tone and speaking pace to suit the caller’s mood and situation

 – Use geographic cues and postcode knowledge to maintain a local-sounding rapport

 – Liaise with internal teams when necessary and escalate issues appropriately

 – Take part in regular training sessions and performance evaluations



Required Skills

 – Clear, fluent English with a neutral or soft accent

 – Strong listening and communication abilities

 – Ability to stay composed and effective during high-pressure or sensitive calls

 – Exceptional attention to detail and consistency in following procedures

 – Comfortable using CRM systems, call management tools, and team communication platforms

 – Reliable work ethic, consistent attendance, and receptiveness to feedback



Preferred Qualifications

 – Prior experience in inbound customer service, dispatch, or call center work

 – Knowledge of lead tracking systems and CRM tools

 – Familiarity with UK or international postcode formats and local area names

 – Quick learner able to adapt to new tools and updated processes

 – Background in handling urgent or service-related inquiries



Technical Setup Needed

 – Stable primary internet connection (minimum 25 Mbps recommended)

 – Backup internet option (pocket Wi-Fi or secondary provider)

 – Backup power source (UPS or generator) for uninterrupted service

 – Personal laptop or desktop computer

 – High-quality noise-cancelling headset

 – Quiet, dedicated work area free from background distractions



Why You’ll Love This Role

Join a remote team where your professionalism and communication skills truly matter. With structured scripts, ongoing training, and no cold calling, you’ll focus on delivering excellent service every time. You’ll gain valuable experience in customer interaction and service coordination while being part of a supportive, improvement-driven environment.

title: Video Editor - Youtube
description:
Job Title: Video Editor for Adventure/Camping Channel (Storytelling & Sound Design Focus) – READ CAREFULLY

Rate: $30 - $50 USD per project (Includes 1 Main Video + 3 Viral Reels) Job Type: Long-term Freelance / "Partner" Relationship Work Setup: Remote



STOP AND READ BEFORE APPLYING  We are looking for a long-term editing partner, not just a one-time freelancer. Do not apply if you use AI-generated templates. Do not apply if you cannot do advanced audio mixing.



The Channel Style I am wanting to create "No Speaking" Solo Camping & Bushcraft videos. There is NO music and NO voiceover. The storytelling is purely visual and based on natural audio atmosphere (ASMR).



You MUST study these 3 channels before applying. We want this EXACT style:



Antonio Off-Grid



Volyn Bushcraft



Go4x4







The Goal: High Engagement & Storytelling Even though the video is relaxing, it must not be boring.



The "Hook" (First 10 Seconds): You must create a high-energy teaser intro. Quick cuts of the best 
nts (fire lighting, steak sizzling, drone shots) to grab the viewer immediately.



Visual Variety: Keep the viewer engaged with different angles. Do not linger on a single static shot for too long unless it is visually stunning.



Chronological Story: The video must flow logically in order: Travel -> Arrival -> Setup -> Cooking -> Night -> Morning -> Pack up.







Key Responsibilities



Sound Design (The #1 Priority):



Since there is no music, you must master the audio mixing.



The "Drone/B-Roll" Rule: If we use a drone shot or a B-roll clip with no audio, you must add natural sound effects (wind, flowing water, birds, footsteps). The video must never be completely silent.







Deliverables Per Project:



1x Long Form Video: 15–20 Minutes (4K, Color Corrected).



3x Viral Reels/Shorts: You must extract 3 engaging vertical clips (9:16) from the main footage to drive traffic to the main video.







The Application Process (Important) We are looking for quality and reliability.



We will review your portfolio.



The Trial: If selected, you will be asked to edit one video as a final test.



NOTE: This trial edit will be UNPAID as part of the final application process. This is to prove you can handle the specific pacing and sound design requirements.



If your trial is successful, you will be hired immediately to work alongside me long-term.



Requirements



Experience with Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut.



Fast internet (for downloading large 4K files).



Access to a Sound Effects library (for wind, rain, nature sounds).



Attention to Detail: You read the instructions and understand exactly what we need.



Thank you very much. I look forward to hearing from you soon

title: Graphic Designer (Canva) - US Company
description:
Marketing Designer: A successful candidate will have 2-4 years of experience executing marketing designs within an established brand system, with a strong ability to translate provided direction, templates, and copy into polished, ready-to-publish assets.



Position Type: Independent Contractor



Location: Remote, Must be located in the Philippines



Rate: $8USD / hour



Estimated weekly hours: 5-10



This role might be perfect for you if you have a strong professional background in digital design. This truly isn't a role for the casual designer or someone without some corporate experience.



Please review the position below and let me know if you are interested. I will then send you the link to apply on our careers page. Once you have applied on our careers page, you will receive a pre-screen survey that must be completed AND an
 with questions and a video request. We are moving quickly on this position and the faster you complete everything, the faster we can get the seats filled!!!



How do you know if this is your dream work and if Fertility Bridge is your dream client? If you think you can achieve these outcomes, this just might be the place for you:



Deliver consistent, on-brand assets that are ready to publish, up to 25 per week. High quality Canva designs using established templates, minimal editing, correct brand typography/colours, and balanced layouts even when copy varies. Patterns that indicate misalignment include off-brand elements, recurring rework, overlooking details, or avoidable design issues. Designers who excel take initiative on small improvements and steadily reduce the amount of editing and oversight needed by the Brand Manager.



Maintain a visually varied, professional feed through strategic design rotation for up to 15 posts per week. Designer will use rotating templates, layouts, typography treatments, and colour usage so the feed never looks repetitive or template-locked, even when posting daily. Patterns that indicate misalignment include when posts look identical across campaigns or lack variation over time. Designers who excel show proactive refinement of visual patterns and contributions to elevate the brand’s overall aesthetic.



Translate marketing strategy into clear, effective visuals, using existing or new assets, up to 25 per week. Direction from the marketing team will be converted into polished, on-strategy designs created in Canva without needing step-by-step guidance, and reducing oversight by Brand Manager over time. Patterns that indicate misalignment include when the intent of a campaign isn’t reflected or when repeated rework is needed to meet the brief. Designers who excel expand the creative library, introduce thoughtful visual variations, and take on asset/email design with increasing independence.

title: YouTube Optimization Specialist
description:
YouTube Specialist Needed

Help Us Maximize the Potential of Our Existing Content



We have two YouTube channels, a creative team consistently producing videos, and a sense that we could be achieving much more with what we already have. That’s where you come in.



We’re not looking for someone to create videos—we need a strategist who can evaluate what we’re doing and suggest smarter ways to approach it. Think of yourself as an optimization expert, an analytics pro, and a strategic advisor all in one.



What You’ll Do:

-Dive into the data for our two channels (one for clients, one for VAs)

-Analyze what's working, what's not, and provide clear insights

-Review and optimize our thumbnails, titles, descriptions, and tags

-Deliver actionable recommendations we can put into practice

-Track which changes make a real impact and which ones don’t

-Bonus points if you're also interested in suggesting content ideas (though this is optional)



What You Need:

-Expertise in YouTube SEO—this isn't your first time around the block

-The ability to interpret analytics and provide meaningful insights

-A proven track record of helping YouTube channels grow

-Strong English communication skills (we need to understand your recommendations!)

-Self-starter mentality, comfortable working independently



Bonus Points If:

-You have experience with B2B content

-You’re familiar with tools like TubeBuddy or VidIQ

-You stay up-to-date with YouTube algorithm updates and best practices

-You’ve analyzed competitor channels and understand what works in various niches



The Setup:

-Start part-time (20 hours/week) or project-based

-If you're excelling, we can discuss transitioning to full-time after one month

-Flexible hours—we care about results, not when you're working



Why You'll Enjoy This:

-You’ll see real impact from your recommendations

-No pressure to create content—just pure strategy

-Opportunities for growth into a bigger role

-Work with a team that values your input and ideas



If you're skilled at spotting opportunities and helping YouTube channels perform better, we want to hear from you. Apply today!

title: Quality Assurance & Process Review Analyst (Non-Voice, Remote)
description:
Quality Assurance & Process Review Analyst (Non-Voice, Remote)



Starlight Marketing is hiring a Quality Assurance & Process Review Analyst to support internal standards across our digital workflows. This role focuses on reviewing outputs, verifying accuracy, and ensuring that established procedures are consistently followed.



The position is fully non-voice and centered on structured evaluation rather than content creation or client interaction. You will work within documented systems and apply predefined quality guidelines to assess completed tasks before and after release.



Core responsibilities include:

-Reviewing digital materials and system updates for compliance with internal standards

-Verifying formatting, tagging, scheduling, and placement accuracy

-Completing quality checklists and maintaining review logs

-Identifying inconsistencies or deviations from process guidelines

-Preparing brief written summaries of findings when needed



This role requires strong attention to detail, objectivity, and the ability to follow procedures consistently. It is well-suited for someone who prefers analytical, system-based work and is comfortable evaluating structured workflows.



The position is remote, long-term, and offers 40–48 hours per week to start. As Starlight Marketing grows, there is potential to transition into senior quality oversight or process improvement roles.



Candidates who are organized, methodical, and comfortable working independently in a non-voice environment will thrive in this role.

If you’re a motivated sales professional with a passion for digital marketing, apply today and help us bring top-tier services to US businesses!

ntum:

title: Quora Specialist VA
description:
Role Overview:

We are looking for an experienced Quora/Reddit Specialist who excels at building an authentic brand presence on community platforms while adhering to platform guidelines and community norms. This role focuses on AEO (AI Engine Optimization)—ensuring that VA MASTERS is positively represented when AI engines reference these platforms. You will create valuable content that naturally fosters favorable brand discussions from both clients and VA candidates.



Key Responsibilities:

-Develop engaging and authentic content for Quora and Reddit that consistently meets platform guidelines

-Build positive brand sentiment and initiate meaningful discussions around VA MASTERS through valuable contributions

-Answer relevant questions and engage in discussions naturally, avoiding promotional spam

-Strategically mention the brand in ways that add value to discussions without detracting from them

-Successfully navigate and comply with Quora and Reddit's strict content policies

-Engage with both potential clients and VA candidate communities in an authentic manner

-Monitor brand mentions across platforms and respond appropriately

-Develop content strategies to influence how AI engines perceive and reference the brand

-Track engagement metrics and adjust strategies based on community feedback



Mandatory Requirements:

-Proven experience getting content approved on Quora and/or Reddit – essential

-In-depth understanding of community guidelines and how to add value while mentioning brands

-Ability to write authentic, helpful content that avoids triggering spam detection

title: Klaviyo Expert & Email Marketing Strategist (E-commerce / Furniture)
description:
About Ornate Home

Ornate Home is a premier furniture retailer in the US. We combine a massive online presence with high-end physical showrooms, delivering nationwide. We don’t just sell furniture; we curate lifestyles. We are looking for an
 marketing veteran to take our Klaviyo account to the next level.



The Mission - Full Remote

We don’t need a "virtual assistant" who can schedule a campaign. We need a Klaviyo Master who understands the nuances of high-ticket e-commerce. You will be responsible for the entire lifecycle: from advanced segmentation and behavioral triggers to hyper-targeted weekly campaigns that drive revenue.



Key Responsibilities

Klaviyo Mastery: Total ownership of the dashboard. If there’s a feature in Klaviyo, you should know how to use it to drive ROI.



Flow Optimization: Build and refine complex flows (Abandoned Cart, Browse Abandonment, Post-Purchase Upsells, Win-backs) specifically tailored for long-sale-cycle items like furniture.



Advanced Segmentation: Segment our massive list based on purchase history, browsing behavior, and geographic location (near our showrooms).



Data-Driven Growth: Run A/B tests on subject lines, layouts, and send times. You should live in the "Analytics" tab.



Design & Copy Oversight: Ensure every
 reflects the premium Ornate Home brand.



Required Qualifications

Proven Track Record: At least 3+ years of experience managing Klaviyo for high-volume e-commerce brands. (Case studies or portfolio required).



The "Furniture Plus": Experience in the furniture or home decor niche is a massive advantage. You understand the "considered purchase" journey.



No Black Spots: You have 100% mastery of Klaviyo—API integrations, custom properties, and multi-step flows are second nature to you.



US Market Savvy: Excellent written English and an understanding of US consumer holidays and buying habits.



How to Apply

To ensure you have high attention to detail, please include the following in your application:



A link to your portfolio or 2–3 specific examples of Klaviyo results you’ve achieved.



Personalization Question: Given that Ornate Home sells large furniture items, what is one specific
 flow or segment you would implement to help a customer d
 on a high-ticket item (like a $3,000 sectional) versus a small accessory?

title: software developer
description:
Looking for a software developer

I’m working on a performance management platform focused on KPIs, dashboards, and management reporting — starting in agribusiness and designed to scale into other sectors.

Importantly, this is not a greenfield idea.

I already have a simple, working performance system in use with real operations (data capture/import, currently Excel- and Power BI-based, not web-based). The existing system is already used for weekly and monthly management reviews and operational decision-making.

The initial trial phase of the project (let’s call it MVP-Lite) is to formalise and streamline what already works into a lightweight web application.

Power BI is the preferred reporting layer.

The web application’s role is to structure, validate, and expose data (via database/data warehouse and/or API) that feeds Power BI dashboards.

I’m looking for a mid-senior software developer to initially assist with this intentionally small web-based MVP-Lite, focused on:

• Basic data imports (Excel / CSV)

• A simple, clean database structure

• A stable data / API layer for Power BI

This first phase is deliberately limited:

• ~5–10 hours per week

• 2–4 weeks

• Proof of concept, not a full product

Subsequent phases of the project would aim to:

• Expand features and build on model structure where required

• Scale to other sectors and countries within the region

• Greatly increase time commitment

• Evolve the role into technical lead, including building a small development team

This is not an ERP or e-commerce project — it’s a practical system used by managers to make decisions.

If this sounds interesting, I’d welcome a short call.

Please let me know:

1. Any experience integrating systems with Power BI or other BI tools

2. Your preferred backend tech stack

3. Your availability over the next few weeks

Best regards,

Giancarlo

title: Part-Time Product Data Manager
description:
Part-Time Product Data Manager

Hours: 15 hrs/week | 3 weekdays/wk | 8AM–1PM EST

Pay: $240/month after probation | $50/week during 2-week probationary period

Location: Remote (must be available during EST working hours)



Position Overview

We’re hiring a E-Commerce Specialist to help us match product SKUs to correct vehicle fitments using our distributor data and online research tools. This is a part-time, entry-level role ideal for someone detail-oriented, reliable, and interested in growing into a long-term ecommerce or product data position.



Responsibilities

- Download and organize SKU data from major distributors

- Research and verify vehicle compatibility using distributor sites

- Match each SKU to its appropriate Year, Make, Model, Bed Size, and Vehicle Options

- Enter fitment data into structured Google Sheets templates

- Maintain accuracy when handling SKUs that apply to multiple vehicles (multi-row entries)

- Collaborate with a small internal team and communicate progress clearly

- Follow SOP guidelines and gradually build product/vehicle generation knowledge



Requirements

- Strong attention to detail and accuracy

- Comfort using Google Sheets and CSV files

- Ability to research using multiple online sources

- Excellent written communication (you’ll be documenting your work)

- Reliable internet and availability during scheduled EST hours (8AM–1PM, 3 days/week)

- Bonus: Interest in trucks, aftermarket parts, or automotive ecommerce



Schedule & Compensation

- Probationary Period (2 weeks): $50/week to assess skill and reliability

- 3 weekday shifts (Mon–Fri), 5 hours each

- After Probation: $240/month Paid Weekly

- 15 hours/week (3 shifts/week, 5 hours each, 8AM–1PM EST)



Why Join Us?

- Flexible, remote work

- Training provided on tools, product types, and vehicle generations

- Growth path into full-time catalog manager or ecommerce roles

- Tight-knit team, direct feedback, and long-term potential for the right person



Please submit your resume (or relevant experience) and a few sentences about why you're interested. Bonus points if you’ve worked in spreadsheets, ecommerce, or the auto industry. 



Please start your application with your FAVORITE HOLIDAY or you won't be considered.

title: Senior Virtual Operations Assistant
description:
---> About the Role



We are a UK-regulated mortgage and insurance brokerage operating under strict FCA compliance standards.



This is not a general VA role.

This is a structured financial operations position within a regulated, documentation-heavy environment.



We require a degree-qualified, financially literate, detail-driven professional to support mortgage and insurance case administration.



---> Minimum Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



-> Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Banking, or Business (financial focus)

-> Strong written English

-> High attention to detail

-> Experience reviewing financial documents

-> Ability to follow structured processes



Preference given to candidates with UK mortgage or insurance experience.



---> Key Responsibilities



Mortgage Administration

-> Review client financial documents (bank statements, payslips, tax returns, company accounts)

-> Identify missing or inconsistent information

-> Prepare lender submission files

-> Upload documents to lender portals

-> Track underwriting conditions

-> Maintain accurate case notes and pipeline stages



Insurance Administration

-> Prepare insurer submissions

-> Track medical underwriting requirements

-> Monitor policy issue status

-> Record compliance documentation accurately



Compliance Support

-> Assist with AML/KYC checks

-> Complete compliance checklists in internal system (360 Lifecycle)

-> Ensure GDPR-compliant file storage

-> Cross-check fact finds and documentation for completeness



Operations

-> Maintain structured digital filing systems

-> Update CRM stages correctly

-> Prepare simple weekly case summaries

-> Escalate discrepancies immediately



---> Technical Understanding Required



-> DIP, LTV, ERC, affordability, underwriting

-> Financial document interpretation

-> Regulated compliance environments

-> Structured case workflows



---> Before We Can Consider Your Application (Mandatory)



-> Record a 3-minute Loom video (no exceptions) covering:

-> Your degree (subject, university, year)

-> Your experience in mortgage and/or insurance (UK preferred)

-> Examples of financial documents you’ve reviewed (bank statements, payslips, tax returns, company accounts, etc.)

-> How you ensure accuracy and avoid mistakes in a regulated environment

-> Why you want a long-term role with Triton Private Finance



-> In your written application, include:

-> Degree + university + graduation year

-> List of relevant roles (mortgage/insurance/finance)

-> Systems/tools used (CRM, lender portals, insurer portals, compliance tools)

-> A short bullet list of your key responsibilities in your most relevant role



-> Add this keyword at the top of your application so we know you read this:

-> “TPF-PRECISE”



Applications without Loom + the keyword will not be reviewed.



---> We Will Not Consider Applicants Who



-> Submit generic applications

-> Do not meet degree requirement

-> Avoid the Loom requirement

-> Cannot demonstrate financial literacy

-> Have only general VA experience with no financial background

title: Life Manager (Project Manager) - Remote Full Time
description:
Hello, we are looking to hire a life manager to support our agency and founder with the agency’s day-to-day operations



This is not a personal assistant role and not a traditional executive assistant role



You will help design, manage, and run systems across both work and personal life so everything operates smoothly, predictably, and with minimal mental overhead



The goal is not just to complete tasks, but to reduce decision fatigue, improve organization, and create leverage through systems, structure, and proactive execution





What success looks like in this role?



• Fewer things falling through the cracks

• Clear priorities every day and week

• Tasks and projects move forward without constant reminders

• Life and business logistics feel “handled”

• Less chaos, more clarity



If that sounds exciting to you, this role fits!



Core responsibilities



Daily / Ongoing



• Managing tasks, reminders, and follow-ups

• Keeping systems organized and up to date

• Tracking priorities and deadlines

• Proactively flagging issues or bottlenecks

• Communicating clearly and concisely



Weekly



• Light project management and coordination

• Reviewing open loops and unfinished items

• Improving existing systems and workflows

• Preparing summaries and updates



Ongoing improvement



• Creating structure where there is chaos

• Documenting processes

• Suggesting better tools or workflows

• Learning fast and adapting to new responsibilities





What we care most about (non-negotiables)



• Full-time dedication only

This must be your only professional role. No side jobs, no freelance work, no agencies.



• High loyalty and long-term mindset

We’re looking for someone who wants stability and growth together, not short-term gigs.



• Extreme attention to detail

You notice small things others miss. You double-check. You follow instructions exactly.



• Ownership mentality

You don’t wait to be told what broke. You flag it, fix it, and improve the system



• Always hungry to learn

You enjoy getting better, learning tools, and expanding responsibility





Skills and experience (flexible but important)



• Some project management experience

• Comfortable working with tasks, deadlines, and priorities

• Familiar with tools like Notion, ClickUp, Asana, Trello, Google Docs, or similar

• Strong written English

• Calm under pressure

• Organized and structured by nature



Experience matters less than how you think



Who this role is NOT for (this saves time)



This role is not a fit if:

• You want to juggle multiple jobs

• You only want to execute tasks you’re told

• You dislike structure, systems, or documentation

• You need constant supervision

• You prefer short-term work



Questions:



Question 1:

Are you comfortable working US (EST) time zone?



Question 2:

Why are you specifically looking for a full-time, long-term role instead of multiple clients or freelance work?



Question 3:

Why are you interested in this role specifically?



Question 4:

What previous experience do you have (work or personal) that would make you a good fit for this role?



Question 5:

What tools or systems have you used to stay organized in past roles?





Important:

To apply, start your application message with the word “Structure” on the first line.



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed



Breakdown Of the Initial Days:



First 30 days:



• Execute tasks accurately

• Learn systems and expectations

• Build trust through consistency



After 60–90 days:



• Proactively manage systems

• Improve workflows

• Take ownership of recurring areas

• Act as a second brain, not just support

s, promos, social content scheduling).

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 3a
description:
APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED: 





CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript/Shopify Liquid required. 

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

- 1+ years of backend python (flask/django) development experience preferred but not required

- 1+ years of marketing agency experience preferred but not required

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

- All applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of experience or education



APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED:

title: Direct Response Video Ads Editor
description:
We are an ambitious and rapidly growing e-commerce brand committed to building a strong presence in the online retail space. As we scale our advertising efforts, we are looking for a skilled and creative Direct Response Video Ads Editor to join our team.



Our marketing strategy relies heavily on compelling video ads designed to convert viewers into buyers. We need someone who understands the psychology of direct response advertising and has the technical skills to produce high-quality, engaging video content that drives results.



You will be working with our marketing team to create impactful video ads using pre-provided B-roll footage. Your ability to craft effective hooks, structure engaging narratives, and utilize AI tools to enhance creativity will be critical to your success. This role requires someone who can not only edit quickly but also deliver content that performs exceptionally well on platforms like Meta Ads.



We are particularly interested in candidates who are motivated to work exclusively with us and contribute to the long-term growth of our brand.



Key Responsibilities:



- Editing direct response video ads using tools such as CapCut, Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or similar apps.



- Crafting high-converting video ads with three hooks per video to maximize engagement.



- Utilizing AI tools like ElevenLabs and AI Personas to enhance creativity and delivery.



- Testing all videos on Meta Ads to evaluate performance and refine creative approaches.



- Collaborating with our marketing team to ensure video content aligns with brand messaging and marketing goals.



- Continuously optimizing editing techniques to improve ad performance.



Qualifications & Skills:



- Proven experience editing direct response ads for e-commerce brands.



- Proficiency in CapCut, Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or similar editing software.



- Familiarity with AI tools like ElevenLabs and AI Personas.



- Strong understanding of direct response advertising principles.



- Ability to work quickly and deliver high-quality content under tight deadlines.



- Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate within a team.



- Motivation to work exclusively for our brand and contribute to its growth.



Application Process:



- To ensure you have read this listing carefully, please begin your application with the phrase: “I create high-converting video ads.”



In your application, please include the following:



- A brief description of your experience with video editing and direct response ads.



- Links to previous work, especially relevant e-commerce ads.



- Your availability and how quickly you can start.



- Why you are interested in working with our brand specifically.



This is a remote position with flexible hours, and compensation will be determined based on your experience and skill level. We are excited to find a talented individual who is eager to grow with us and consistently deliver outstanding results.



Apply now to join our team and help us take our advertising efforts to the next level.

title: Junior Systems & Automation Developer
description:
First things first…

This is a 100% remote position. The current annual salary range for this position is $30,000 - $55,000 USD + bonus opportunity.

This position will support our portfolio of internal companies that span across different industries (including mortgage compliance to HR/bookkeeping). However, the first year will be highly focused on our company: MQMR.





What You’ll Do

You are the "Apprentice" to the Systems Team. While the Lead AI Engineer designs the architecture, you are responsible for the foundational coding, testing, and maintenance that keeps the system running.



This is a growth role for a developer who wants to specialize in AI and Automation. You will not be designing complex architecture on Day 1; you will be writing Python scripts, testing automation workflows, cleaning data for AI models, and ensuring our code is bug-free before it goes live.





Key Responsibilities

A. Automation & Scripting Support 

- Python & Scripting: Write and maintain basic Python scripts to support data extraction and automation logic. You must be comfortable writing code to solve specific, small-scope problems.

- Workflow Support: Assist in building and debugging workflows in N8n or other automation tools. You implement the "If/Then" logic defined by the Lead Engineer.

- Maintenance: Monitor existing automations. If a script fails or an API connection breaks, you are the first responder to investigate and patch it.



B. Quality Assurance (QA) & Testing

- The "Tester": Before any AI agent or automation is released to the business, you break it. You run test cases to ensure the logic holds up under different scenarios.

- Logic Check: You review workflows to ensure they match the requirements provided by the Coordinator/Director before they are deployed.

- Bug Tracking: You document errors clearly and work with the Lead Engineer to resolve them.



C. Data Hygiene & Preparation 

- Data Formatting: You prepare, format, and clean data sets (CSV/Excel) to be ingested by our AI agents or HubSpot. You ensure dates, names, and integers are formatted correctly.

- HubSpot Data: Assist in bulk data updates, list cleaning, and maintaining the integrity of our CRM database so our automation tools can read it accurately.



D. Web & Technical Support 

- Basic Web Updates: Handle minor updates to the company website using HTML/CSS (fixing typos, updating images, or changing layout elements).

- Tier 1 Support: Handle basic technical requests from the team to free up the Lead Engineer for high-level architectural work.



What Will Make You Successful

- Coding Literacy: You must have working knowledge of Python. Familiarity with HTML/CSS and basic SQL is expected.

- Experience: 2-5 years in Junior Development, Data Analysis, or a related technical field (fresh Computer Science graduates welcome).

- Tech Stack:

          - Code: Python (Must have), HTML/CSS (Basic).

          - Tools: Familiarity with Git/GitHub is a plus.

          - Data: Strong operational Excel skills (VLOOKUPs, data formatting) or basic SQL.

- Logic Mindset: You enjoy solving puzzles and can follow data flow logic (e.g., "If this happens, then that happens").

- Coachability: You are eager to learn. You take feedback well and want to be molded into a high-level AI Engineer over the next 1–2 years.

- Attention to Detail: You spot the missing comma in the code or the wrong date format in the spreadsheet before anyone else does.

- Language: C1/C2 English proficiency.



Atomus Core Value Alignment

- Commit to Quality: You have an "acute attention to detail" and spot the missing comma in the code or the wrong date format in the spreadsheet before anyone else does.

- Create Solutions: When a data flow logic isn't performing, you don't just report it; you fix it.

- Collaborate as One: You work seamlessly with our Sales and Operations teams.

- Cultivate Raving Fans: You don’t just deliver a solution; you create an experience that empowers your colleagues

- Climb Higher: You are committed to constant professional and personal improvement.



What We Do At Atomus

Atomus — from the Latin word for “atoms,” the basic building blocks of the universe. At Atomus Partners, we’re the building blocks for growth. We step in as trusted partners to help small and mid-size businesses strengthen and scale their most critical functions — HR, Talent Acquisition & Finance/Accounting — so leaders can stay focused on what they do best: growing their business.



We don’t just solve today’s challenges — we help our clients see beyond today, laying the foundation for long-term success and sustainable growth.





Why Join the Atomus Team?

Are you a code-literate puzzle solver ready to bridge the gap between foundational scripts and complex AI automation while building your career as a world-class developer? 



If so, join us! Working at Atomus means living and breathing our core values: Commit to Quality, Create Solutions, Collaborate as One, Cultivate Raving Fans, and Climb Higher. 



Here, you’ll do more than just “work a job” — you’ll solve meaningful problems, stretch your skills, and grow faster than you ever thought possible. One year at Atomus is the equivalent of three to five years elsewhere. We’re looking for people who are hungry to build, learn, and make an impact — not just clock in and out.



We are more than just a firm; we are a community that has mastered virtual culture. We’ve always been 100% remote, maintaining a 70+ Employee Net Promoter Score. We host monthly virtual activities and wellness challenges. We offer a holistic environment with flexible PTO where we don't count days, and annual performance bonuses.

 If you share our values and are excited by the challenge of bridging the gap between risk and compliance, we’d love to hear from you.



If interested, please apply through our Paylocity job link:

title: Social Media & Growth Marketer (Content + LinkedIn Outbound)
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

 



THE OPPORTUNITY

Join a fast-growing U.S.-based fintech company as the hands-on Social Media & Campaign Manager.

You will be the execution engine behind an AI-assisted marketing system that reaches 250,000+ traders.



We write ALL content using AI (Claude). Your job is to manage, schedule, publish,

track, and optimize across 8 platforms daily. This is an execution role, not a writing role.



Position Details



Detail Information

Job Title Social Media & Campaign Manager

Company Invest Like A Millionaire (
)

Industry Fintech / Trading Technology / SaaS

Location 100% Remote — Philippines-based

Hours Full-time (40 hrs/week) — Must overlap 9 AM–12 PM U.S. Eastern Time

Start Date ASAP (Target: March 1, 2026)

Reports To Founder & CEO (Pranav Sahai, Princeton, NJ, USA)

Compensation $800–$1,200 USD/month (based on experience), with performance bonuses

Contract Long-term contractor, paid monthly via Wise, PayPal, or similar

Growth Path Marketing Manager ? Head of Marketing Operations (within 12 months)



About the Company

Invest Like A Millionaire (ILAM) is a trading technology platform launching April 1, 2026. We combine two proprietary products — ILAM Scanner (systematic buy/sell signals using a 5-criteria methodology) and Sentinel Alpha (24/7 portfolio risk monitoring) — into a unified Trading Command Center for experienced traders and high-net-worth investors.



Our founder, Pranav Sahai, is a Top 1% U.S. mortgage broker with 20+ years in finance, featured in the Wall Street Journal and Scotsman Guide. ILAM is backed by real financial expertise, not hype.



We are a lean, high-velocity team. You will be employee #1 on the marketing side, working directly with the CEO daily. This is a ground-floor opportunity with a company targeting rapid growth.

?

HOW THIS ROLE WORKS

 



THE AI-POWERED WORKFLOW

We use Claude (AI) to write one master content piece per day.

Claude repurposes that single piece into 8 platform-specific versions.

YOUR JOB: Take those 8 versions, format them, schedule them, publish them,

track their performance, and report results. Every single day.



Your Daily Workflow



Step 1: Receive Daily Content Package (Morning)

Each morning, the CEO or AI assistant will provide you with a content package containing one master post repurposed into 8 platform-specific versions. Your Google Sheet editorial calendar will tell you what topic is scheduled for that day.

Step 2: Format & Customize for Each Platform

Take each platform version and apply the correct formatting, hashtags, image/video attachments, link placement, and character limits. Add any platform-specific touches (e.g., LinkedIn has no links in body, Instagram needs image,
 needs thread format).

Step 3: Schedule or Publish

Publish posts at optimal times for each platform using scheduling tools (Buffer, Hootsuite, or native schedulers). Some posts will be immediate; others will be scheduled 1-3 days ahead.

Step 4: Engage & Monitor

Monitor comments, replies, and DMs across all 8 platforms. Respond to engagement within 2 hours during your working hours. Flag high-value leads or important messages to the CEO immediately via Slack.

Step 5: Track & Report

Update the master Google Sheets tracking dashboard daily. Record post performance metrics (impressions, engagement, clicks, followers gained). Compile weekly summary report every Friday.



The 8 Platforms You Will Manage



Platform Post Type Frequency Key Metrics

LinkedIn Long-form posts, articles, carousels 2x/day Impressions, comments, profile views

/X Threads, short takes, market commentary 3-5x/day Impressions, retweets, link clicks

 Posts, group shares, live video clips 1x/day Reach, engagement rate, shares

Instagram Feed posts, Stories, Reels 1x/day + 2-3 Stories Reach, saves, profile visits

YouTube Videos, Shorts, community posts 2-3x/week Views, watch time, subscribers

TikTok Short educational clips, trends 3-5x/week Views, shares, followers

Reddit Value-add posts in finance subreddits 2-3x/week Upvotes, comments, traffic

 Newsletter Weekly edition of The Millionaire’s Blueprint 1x/week Open rate, click rate, unsubscribes



IMPORTANT: WHAT YOU DO NOT NEED TO DO

? Write original content from scratch (AI does this)

? Create marketing strategy (CEO + AI handle this)

? Design complex graphics (we will provide templates and Canva access)

? Run paid advertising campaigns (separate responsibility)

? Make financial or investment decisions



? You ARE the execution engine that makes the strategy come alive every day

?

DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES

 



Core Responsibilities (80% of Time)



1. Daily Content Publishing & Scheduling

• Receive AI-generated content packages daily and publish across all 8 platforms

• Format each post correctly for the specific platform (character limits, hashtags, link placement, media attachments)

• Use scheduling tools (Buffer, Hootsuite, Later, or native schedulers) to publish at optimal times

• Maintain the master editorial calendar in Google Sheets — update status of every post daily

• Ensure every post includes required SEC compliance disclaimers (templates provided)

2. Community Engagement & Response Management

• Monitor all 8 platforms for comments, replies, DMs, and mentions during working hours

• Respond to comments and questions within 2 hours (response templates will be provided for common questions)

• Escalate high-value leads, partnership inquiries, or press/media requests to CEO via Slack immediately

• Flag and handle negative comments or trolls per the response protocol (provided)

• Engage proactively: comment on 10+ relevant posts daily on LinkedIn from target audience members

3. Google Sheets Tracking & Reporting

• Maintain master content calendar tracking: post date, platform, topic, status (scheduled/published/draft)

• Update daily metrics dashboard: impressions, engagement, clicks, followers, leads generated per platform

• Compile weekly performance report (template provided) every Friday by 5 PM PH time

• Track trial signups attributed to social media (using UTM links we provide)

• Maintain competitor activity log: note competitor posts, campaigns, or product changes weekly



Secondary Responsibilities (20% of Time)



4.
 Newsletter Execution

• Format and send weekly "Millionaire’s Blueprint" newsletter using
 platform (ConvertKit or HubSpot)

• Content will be written by AI and approved by CEO — you format, load, test, and send

• Monitor open rates, click rates, and unsubscribes; report weekly

5. Basic Graphic Adaptation

• Use Canva (templates provided) to create simple social media graphics from content

• Resize and adapt graphics for different platforms (LinkedIn banner vs. Instagram square vs.
 card)

• Create simple quote cards, stat graphics, and countdown graphics for campaigns

• No advanced design skills needed — we provide branded Canva templates

6. Administrative & Coordination Support

• Maintain login credentials and access for all social media accounts (secure password manager)

• Coordinate with CEO on daily content approval via Slack (quick turnaround expected)

• Help schedule and promote podcast appearances, webinars, and live events

• Manage affiliate partner social media toolkit distribution

?

REQUIREMENTS

 



Must-Have Skills



Skill Proficiency Level How We’ll Test

Google Sheets Advanced — formulas, pivot tables, conditional formatting, dashboards Live skills test during interview

Social Media Platforms Expert user of LinkedIn,
/X,
, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok Show us your own active profiles

English (Written) Excellent — near-native grammar and spelling for captions, replies,
s Written test during interview

English (Spoken) Strong conversational — daily Slack calls with CEO Video interview

Scheduling Tools Experience with Buffer, Hootsuite, Later, or similar Describe your current workflow

Canva Basic to Intermediate — resize graphics, use templates, create simple designs Create a sample post in Canva

 Marketing Basic experience with ConvertKit, Mailchimp, HubSpot, or similar Walk us through a past campaign

Attention to Detail Exceptional — zero tolerance for typos in published content Proofread test during interview

Time Management Self-directed — manage daily publishing across 8 platforms without reminders Describe your daily routine

Communication Proactive — flag issues before they become problems, ask questions early Behavioral interview questions



Nice-to-Have (Not Required)

• Experience in finance, fintech, or trading industry (you will learn quickly if not)

• Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude) for content assistance

• Basic video editing skills (CapCut, InShot, or similar for short-form video)

• Experience managing social media for a U.S.-based company

• Familiarity with SEO basics and UTM tracking

• Experience with WordPress or Webflow



Personality & Work Style

This role requires someone who is:



• Relentlessly consistent: Publishing must happen every single day. Rain or shine. No excuses. We are building daily habits for our audience.

• Detail-obsessed: One typo on a financial services post can damage credibility. You triple-check everything before publishing.

• Proactive communicator: If something is unclear, you ask immediately. You don’t guess. You flag problems before they escalate.

• Comfortable with speed: We move fast. Content packages arrive in the morning and need to be live by mid-day. This is not a "whenever you get to it" role.

• Trustworthy with access: You will have login credentials to all company social media accounts and
 tools. We need someone we can trust completely.

• Growth-minded: This is a ground-floor opportunity. If you perform well, you will grow into a Marketing Manager role with higher compensation and expanded responsibility.

?

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

 



Component Details

Base Pay $800–$1,200 USD/month (based on experience and skill level)

Performance Bonus Up to $200/month for hitting KPI targets (trial signups, engagement growth)

13th Month Bonus One additional month’s pay in December (Philippine standard)

Schedule Monday–Friday, 40 hours/week. Some weekend posting required (can be pre-scheduled)

Time Overlap Must be available 9 AM–12 PM U.S. Eastern Time daily (9 PM–12 AM PH time)

Tools Provided Canva Pro, Buffer/Hootsuite,
 platform, Google Workspace, Slack, Loom

Training Full onboarding with CEO during Week 1. Detailed playbook and SOPs provided on Day 1.

Growth Path 3-month review ? 6-month review ? 12-month promotion path to Marketing Manager

Payment Monthly via Wise, PayPal, or Payoneer (your choice)

PTO 10 paid days off per year + Philippine national holidays



Performance Bonus Structure

In addition to base pay, you can earn up to $200/month in performance bonuses tied to clear, measurable targets:



KPI Target Bonus

Posts Published On-Time 100% of scheduled posts published daily $50/month

Engagement Growth 10% month-over-month growth in total engagement $50/month

Trial Signups from Social 15+ trial signups/month attributed to social (UTM tracked) $50/month

Weekly Report Delivered On-time, complete weekly report every Friday $25/month

Zero Compliance Errors No posts published without required disclaimers $25/month

?

TOOLS & SYSTEMS YOU WILL USE

 



Tool Purpose Your Skill Level Needed

Google Sheets Editorial calendar, performance tracking, KPI dashboards, competitor log Advanced (formulas, pivots, charts)

Google Docs Content review, SOPs, playbook reference Intermediate

Slack Daily communication with CEO, real-time coordination Comfortable user

Buffer or Hootsuite Social media scheduling and publishing across all platforms Experienced

Canva Pro Graphics adaptation, resizing, template-based design Basic to Intermediate

ConvertKit or HubSpot
 newsletter formatting, sending, and analytics Basic

Loom Screen recordings for async updates, training, and demos Basic

Claude (AI) Receive content from AI — no prompting required, just receive and execute None (we handle AI)

1Password or LastPass Secure credential management for all social accounts Basic

WordPress or Webflow Occasional blog post publishing (content provided) Basic (nice-to-have)



SAMPLE DAILY SCHEDULE

 



Time (PH) Time (US ET) Activity Duration

8:00 AM 8:00 PM (prev day) Start shift. Review editorial calendar. Check overnight messages. 30 min

8:30 AM  Receive daily content package. Review all 8 platform versions. 30 min

9:00 AM  Format and customize posts for each platform. Attach images/videos. Add hashtags. 90 min

10:30 AM  Schedule or publish posts across all 8 platforms. 60 min

11:30 AM  Proactive engagement: comment on 10+ LinkedIn posts from target audience. 30 min

12:00 PM  Lunch break 60 min

1:00 PM  Monitor comments and replies across all platforms. Respond to engagement. 60 min

2:00 PM  Update Google Sheets: post status, daily metrics, any notable activity. 30 min

2:30 PM 
 newsletter tasks (if publishing day) or Canva graphics for upcoming posts. 60 min

3:30 PM  Respond to any remaining comments/DMs. Flag items to CEO in Slack. 30 min

4:00 PM  Plan tomorrow: review calendar, pre-load any scheduled content. 30 min

4:30 PM  End of day wrap-up. Slack message to CEO with day summary. 15 min

9:00 PM 9:00 AM Overlap window: Live Slack availability for CEO sync (30-60 min). 60 min

?

HOW TO APPLY

 



Application Requirements

Please submit ALL of the following. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



1. Resume/CV (PDF format) highlighting relevant social media and Google Sheets experience

2. Links to your personal social media profiles (LinkedIn is required; others are a plus)

3. Links to 2-3 social media accounts you currently manage or have managed for a client/employer

4. A short Loom video (2-3 minutes max) introducing yourself and answering: "What makes you great at managing social media for someone else’s brand?"

5. A screenshot of a Google Sheet you have built or maintained that shows your organizational skills (blur any confidential data)



Hiring Process



Step What Happens Timeline

1. Application Submit all required materials Ongoing

2. Screening We review your profiles, Loom video, and Google Sheets sample 2-3 days

3. Skills Test 30-minute live test: format a post for 3 platforms + build a tracking row in Google Sheets Scheduled within 1 week

4. Video Interview 30-minute Zoom call with CEO Pranav Sahai Same week as skills test

5. Paid Trial Week 1-week paid trial at $200 — publish real content under supervision Following week

6. Offer Full-time contract begins Upon successful trial



WHAT MAKES YOU STAND OUT

Show us your consistency — we want to see accounts you’ve posted to daily for months

Show us your organization — a clean, detailed Google Sheet is worth more than a fancy resume

Show us your speed — in the Loom video, demonstrate you can move fast and communicate clearly

Show us your attention to detail — if your application has typos, we will notice



Where to Apply

Send your complete application to: 

Subject line: "ILAM Social Media Manager Application — [Your Full Name]"



Applications without the Loom video will not be considered. We value effort and initiative.





 



Invest Like A Millionaire — True North 2016 LLC

Princeton, NJ, USA |

title: Legal Billing and Document Specialist
description:
Job Summary:



The Legal Billing and Document Specialist is a critical role responsible for ensuring the accurate and timely financial tracking, documentation, and organizational support necessary for the firm’s litigation practice. This position requires meticulous attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and proficiency in specialized legal software to manage time entry, billing, document control, and critical deadline calendaring.



Key Responsibilities:



Billing & Time Entry

* Enter attorney time into the billing system (Timeslips), including time spent on
s, document review, drafting, research, and other billable tasks.

* Save documents to the appropriate client file and ensure they are billed when applicable 
 attachments, pleadings, motions, orders, discovery documents, etc.)

* Bill cost logs to client files in Timeslips, including postage, copies, FedEx, and other firm expenses.

* Enter and bill Westlaw research costs.



Document Management & File Organization

* Save, label, and organize electronic documents to the correct client folders.

* Identify the correct case for each document received and match it to the corresponding client file with accuracy and consistency.

* Organize case files in preparation for hearings, depositions, and trials, including creating digital folders and ensuring all required materials are included.

* Create and label digital exhibit binders for hearings and trials.



Calendaring

* Calendar all case-related deadlines, including those contained in trial orders and other court notices.

* Track and maintain upcoming deadlines and notify attorneys of due dates, requirements, and approaching tasks.

* Calendar hearings, meetings, attorney appointments, and litigation events as required.



Qualifications:

* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.

*  Experience in a law office is preferred, especially with billing systems such as Timeslips (REQUIRED)

* Ability to follow detailed procedures for saving, labeling, and billing documents.

* Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple deadlines.

* Familiarity with legal documents (pleadings, motions, discovery) is a plus.

* Proficiency with Microsoft Office, PDF editing tools, and document management systems.

* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.





To fast track your application, please submit the following information:

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."

title: Executive Assistant & Operations Support (Real Estate)
description:
We’re looking for a proactive, detail-driven Executive Assistant & Operations Support professional to become the operational backbone of our real estate team. This role blends admin excellence, CRM management, contract coordination, and team support to ensure nothing slips through the cracks.



You will be the person who keeps the engine running supporting leadership, serving the team, and ensuring clients experience seamless communication from start to finish.



Mission of the Role:



The mission of this role is simple: reduce friction.



Protect leadership time, maintain clean and accurate systems, support agents and stakeholders, and ensure every deal and task moves forward without constant chasing.



You are the calm operator in the background warm with clients, direct with the team, and always thinking one step ahead.



Core Responsibilities:



Executive & Leadership Support (25%)

- Manage inbox and calendar with efficiency and prioritisation

- Reduce unnecessary back-and-forth communication

- Handle personal EA tasks where required

- Think first, escalate second



CRM & Database Management (20%)

- Maintain a fully updated, accurate, and organised CRM (Salesforce-style system)

- Ensure all contacts, notes, deal stages, and documentation are current

- Regularly audit and clean database entries



Listing & Contract Administration (25%)

- Prepare contracts accurately and on time 

- Coordinate documentation and compliance requirements

- Liaise with stakeholders to collect and chase required paperwork

- Ensure zero-error documentation wherever possible



Team Support & Task Coordination (20%)

- Track and follow up on team tasks and deadlines

- Be the go-to support person for admin-related requests

- Proactively identify bottlenecks before they become problems

- Act as the “team hero” someone who supports without needing to be chased



Client & Stakeholder Communication (10%) 

- Maintain warm, professional communication with clients and suppliers

- Follow up on outstanding items with confidence and clarity 

- Represent the team with professionalism and integrity



(Optional Bonus Skill)

Assist with light social posting or short-form video edits if capable (not essential)



Success Metrics

You’ll know you’re thriving in this role when:

- CRM is consistently clean, current, and audit-ready

- Contracts are prepared accurately with minimal revisions 

- Tea
mbers rarely need to follow up twice

- Leadership time is freed up by 5+ hours per week

- Stakeholders comment positively on communication and responsiveness



Weekly “Big 3” Priorities

- Keep CRM fully updated and accurate

- Prepare and coordinate all contracts without errors

- Track and follow up on outstanding team tasks and documentation



If these three are handled well, the business flows smoothly.



Our Culture in Action



We value ownership, integrity, and clear communication.



We are warm and client-facing externally, but internally we are direct and solution-oriented. We appreciate people who think before escalating, bring solutions instead of problems, and don’t need chasing.



This is a team environment collaboration matters. You must be comfortable supporting multiple tea
mbers while maintaining professionalism and boundaries.



If you enjoy being the steady operator who makes everyone else look good, you’ll thrive here.



Logistics & Tools

- Full-time role

- Remote / work-from-home

- CRM similar to Salesforce (training provided if needed)

- Google Workspace knowledge

- Reliable Internet, Computer and Headset with Mic

- Strong written and verbal communication skills essential



Final Note

We’re not looking for someone who just completes tasks.



We’re looking for someone who takes ownership who sees what needs to happen and moves it forward.



If you’re proactive, organised, and take pride in being the person the team can rely on, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Head of Product & Supply Chain
description:
DTC E-commerce Brand | Fully Remote | Full-Time



PLEASE APPLY USING THIS FORM:

wkf.ms/3LqKQVm



About the Role

We’re looking for a Head of Supply Chain & Sourcing to own our end-to-end supply chain across a fast-scaling DTC e-commerce business.



This is a commercial, operational, and strategic leadership role, not a coordination role. You will own sourcing, supplier negotiations, product development communication, inventory strategy, logistics, and cost control across our entire product portfolio.



Your goal is simple:

Protect margin, ensure product availability, reduce risk, and build a scalable supply chain system that grows with the business.



You will work closely with Operations, Finance, Marketing, and Product to align inventory, sourcing, and production decisions with demand planning, launches, and cashflow.



Key Responsibilities

- Strategic Sourcing & Supplier Leadership

- Source, vet, and onboard manufacturers via Alibaba and other B2B platforms

- Lead factory negotiations on pricing, MOQs, payment terms, lead times, and production capacity

- Build and maintain multi-supplier strategies to reduce risk and improve cost leverage

- Own supplier performance, quality standards, and long-term partnerships



Product Development & Production Ownership

- Lead product development communication with factories, including specifications, samples, packaging, and production readiness

- Manage New Product Introduction (NPI) from concept through mass production and fulfillment

- Coordinate with Marketing and Product to align production with launches and promotions



Inventory, Logistics & Fulfillment Strategy

- Own rolling inventory forecasts, reorder points, and weeks-of-cover planning

- Manage international freight, customs, tariffs, and 3PL relationships

- Track shipments, resolve delays, and optimize logistics costs and delivery times

- Ensure accurate stock allocation across Shopify, Amazon (FBA), and other channels



Commercial & Financial Ownership

- Own COGS and landed cost modeling across products and suppliers

- Partner with Finance on inventory-driven cashflow planning and PO scheduling

- Drive cost-reduction initiatives across sourcing, production, and logistics



Systems, Process & Scale

- Build and improve forecasting, inventory, and supplier performance systems

- Develop SOPs for sourcing, purchasing, production tracking, and logistics



Who We’re Looking For

Must-Have

- Proven experience in supply chain leadership, sourcing, or operations for e-commerce or consumer products

- Hands-on experience sourcing manufacturers on Alibaba or B2B platforms

- Strong track record of negotiating with factories on price, MOQs, payment terms, and lead times

- Experience managing product development communication and production cycles

- Strong understanding of COGS, landed cost, freight economics, and cashflow impact

- Experience working with 3PLs, freight forwarders, and international shipping

- Highly organized, commercial-minded, and comfortable owning numbers and decisions

- Experience with Shopify, Amazon FBA, and multi-channel inventory management



Nice to Have

- Familiarity with Prediko or inventory planning tools

- Experience supporting high-volume DTC brands

- Experience building or managing remote operations teams



Work hours: 10am to 6pm Manila Time, with calls every Monday and Friday nights (10pm MNL)



PLEASE APPLY USING THIS FORM:

wkf.ms/3LqKQVm

wkf.ms/3LqKQVm

title: Production Controller (DIRECT CLIENT)
description:
The Production Controller is responsible for planning, coordinating, and monitoring manufacturing operations to ensure efficient production flow, on-time delivery, and optimal inventory levels. This role requires strong organizational skills, technical understanding, supplier coordination experience, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced electronics manufacturing environment.



Key Responsibilities

1. Production Planning & Scheduling

Develop, maintain, and optimize production schedules to meet customer delivery deadlines.

Balance material availability, labor capacity, and workflow priorities.

Adjust plans based on urgent orders, capacity constraints, and changing customer requirements.

Allocate and manage work assignments for production personnel.



2. Material & Inventory Coordination

Manage stock levels to prevent shortages and overstocking.

Work closely with purchasing and warehouse teams to ensure timely availability of materials and components.

Oversee inventory management within MRP/ERP systems.

Ensure accurate tracking of raw materials, components, and finished goods.



3. Purchasing & Supplier Management

Source and purchase materials from various suppliers.

Identify and secure alternative suppliers when necessary.

Communicate effectively with suppliers via
, phone, and other channels.

Monitor supplier performance and delivery timelines.



4. Progress Monitoring & Reporting

Track daily production performance and identify potential delays.

Implement corrective actions to keep production schedules on track.

Maintain accurate data in MRP/ERP systems.

Generate reports to support operational and management decision-making.



5. Process Improvement

Collaborate with production, quality, and operations teams to streamline workflows.

Support lean manufacturing initiatives and waste reduction efforts.

Continuously seek improvements in efficiency, cost control, and productivity.



6. Compliance & Safety

Ensure production activities comply with company policies, quality standards, and health & safety regulations.

Required Skills & Experience

Experience in electronics manufacturing.

Strong knowledge of Bill of Materials (BOM) structures.

Familiarity with MRP/ERP systems.

Experience in stock management and inventory control.

Proven experience in purchasing and supplier coordination.

Ability to research, analyze, and complete projects with minimal supervision.

Strong administrative background.

Technical aptitude and ability to handle technical documentation.

Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).

Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

Ability to multitask and meet strict deadlines.

Inquisitive mindset with strong problem-solving ability.

Self-motivated and capable of independent learning.



Key Competencies

Planning & Organizing

Analytical Thinking

Supplier Negotiation

Time Management

Communication

Adaptability

Initiative & Continuous Learning



If interested, kindly send your CV link. No link = automatically skipped
