title: ???? VIDEO EDITOR / 2D ANIMATOR / RETENTION EDITOR (SHORT-FORM)
description:
???? 2D ANIMATOR / RETENTION EDITOR (SHORT-FORM)



APPLY ONLY IF YOU STRONGLY BELIEVE THAT YOU ARE QUALIFIED AND HAVE A GOOD PORTFOLIO TO BACK IT UP



Creator Pro is hiring a video editor who doubles as a retention engineer. If your edits don't increase watch time, hold attention, and guide cognition, this is not the role.



THIS ROLE IS ABOUT ONE THING: RETENTION



We will bring the idea / topic / raw file. You bring the retention and set expectations through pacing, structure, visual & audio hierarchy



You think in terms of:



- Drop-off points

- Cognitive load

- Visual anchors

- Pattern interrupts

- Retention lines

- Brand associations

- Timing beats effects

- Movement that amplifies the message



WHAT YOU'LL ACTUALLY DO:



- Edit 20–60 second short-form videos (Reels / Shorts) using traditional edits mixed with light animations that keep audience retention and increase learning ability.

- Collaborate with strategy (not just execute blindly)

- Study top creators for new strategies that are thriving

- Improve the system over time, not reinvent it every week



STYLE REFERENCES WE ARE SEEKING:

Train Bloom (Main Style - Animations & Sound Effects)





NOTE: If your work doesn't feel at this level or above, please don't apply.



HARD REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE):



- Strong proficiency in retention-driven 2D animation, motion graphics, explainer videos

- Deep understanding of short-form retention mechanics (IG, YT, TikTok)

- Strong pulse on what's currently working on social media

- Fluent English comprehension



SOFT SKILLS:



- You care about outcomes / impact on our audience

- You can take direct feedback

- You iterate fast without ego

- You look for retention improvements and validate them with data



COMPENSATION



- $15-$40 / Hr



Pay scales with:



- Speed

- Reliability

- Retention quality

- Performance



Long-term upside for editors who become core operators

This is not gig work. This is a long-term seat if you earn it.



BENEFITS:



- Competitive Salary: Offering an attractive salary range with growth potential

- Career Growth: Opportunity to be the leader of the media team and long-term career prospects within the Creator Pro ecosystem

- Creative Freedom: Encouraging innovation and personal input in design projects

- Dynamic Work Environment: Working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving industry

- Collaborative Culture: Being part of a driven and supportive team

- Learning Opportunities: Exposure to industry-leading practices and continuous professional development



ABOUT CREATOR PRO:

We build high-retention content systems for elite creators and personal brands. We turn ideas into authority-driven short-form content that holds attention, builds trust, and compounds over time. We don't chase trends, we engineer clarity, retention, and long-term brand equity. Our editors work directly on James' content and select Creator Pro clients, with fixed monthly pay and performance-based bonuses tied to results.



CREATOR PRO VALUES:



- Retention Over Aesthetics: Pretty content that doesn't hold attention is useless

- Clarity Over Cleverness: If the edit distracts from the message, it failed

- Systems Over Talent: Repeatable excellence beats one-off brilliance

- Strong Character: Be the type of person whom people are proud to associate with personally and professionally

- Sincere Candor: Nothing great can be built without feedback; internally or externally

- Competitive Greatness: Be at your best when your best is needed. You enjoy a hard challenge



We look forward to working with you!

title: Ecommerce Operations Manager – Full Ownership (Shopify Dropshipping)
description:
We operate and scale multiple fashion ecommerce dropshipping brands on Shopify, promoted organically on TikTok.



One of our brands has a strong reputation (Trustpilot 4.6 rating with hundreds of reviews), and we are expanding rapidly with additional stores planned this year.



Due to growth, we are hiring an Ecommerce Operations Manager who will take full ownership of fulfillment operations, supplier performance, dispute prevention, and brand reputation.



This role is designed for a senior profile who can run the function, build systems, and make decisions independently.



ABOUT THE ROLE



If your background is mainly answering tickets and you have not owned supplier performance, disputes, and operational KPIs, this role is not a fit.



You will be responsible for owning and improving our Ecommerce Operations across multiple Shopify stores.



This is not a basic customer support role and not a VA execution role.

You will manage the department, supervise Customer Support VAs, and take responsibility for operational KPIs.



Your responsibilities include:



-Owning supplier performance and fulfillment reliability across multiple Chinese suppliers

-Preventing and resolving operational issues (late shipments, wrong items, missing orders, fulfillment confusion)

-Enforcing supplier rules inside Shopify (who fulfills what, and how orders are handled)

-Managing invoice discipline and accuracy (timeliness, errors, corrections, follow-ups)

-Supporting margin improvement by coordinating quotes and supplier switches when needed

-Managing quality issues by tracking product complaints and coordinating improvements with suppliers

-Owning dispute and chargeback management (PayPal + card disputes), improving win rates and reducing dispute risk

-Owning Trustpilot reputation management (steady review flow, professional responses, root-cause improvements)

-Creating, improving, and enforcing SOPs across operations and customer experience

-Defining, tracking, and reporting key KPIs (supplier reliability, fulfillment speed/errors, refunds/disputes, customer satisfaction, reviews)

-Managing and improving the work of our Customer Support VA (quality control, escalation rules, templates, performance standards)



This role requires judgment, structure, and the ability to take full ownership of outcomes.



REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT)



You should have:



-Strong experience in Shopify ecommerce operations (dropshipping experience is highly preferred)

mber (CS VA, support agents, etc.)

mbers with respect and consistency.

title: Property Ops Lead – Guest Experience + Refurb Coordination
description:
We are a UK-based property investment and serviced accommodation (SA) management company. We operate seven serviced accommodation units and focus on delivering a consistent, high-standard guest experience through strong operational systems and quality control. Alongside SA operations, we run two to three active refurbishment/development projects at any given time, coordinating contractors, procurement, documentation, and stakeholder communication to deliver projects efficiently and to a high standard.



This is a hands-on Operations Lead role responsible for execution across our serviced accommodation portfolio and coordination support across refurbishment/development projects. Your core focus is proactive quality control and consistent delivery: you’ll enforce standards through checklists and evidence, ensure guests have a smooth end-to-end experience, and reduce recurring issues by continuously improving SOPs. In parallel, you’ll support project coordination for refurbishments by running follow-ups with contractors and suppliers, managing documentation, and scheduling appointments to keep workstreams moving without drift.



We’re hiring an Operations Lead who can run a cadence, enforce quality standards, and coordinate delivery across both serviced accommodation and active refurb projects.



Monday- Sunday:10:00-18:00 ( with 1 hour break) UK time, Saturday or Sunday off for one day.

Salary :700 USD Per month+ KPI bonus



Core responsibilities

Serviced Accommodation operations (delivery + standards)

- Enforce unit standards using checklists, photo evidence, and “definition of done” quality bars.

- Manage guest communications: fast responses, professional tone, calm resolution, and proactive updates.

- Maintain an issues/defects log and ensure issues are fully closed with root-cause prevention (not just “ticket closed”).

- Coordinate cleaners and operational VAs: confirm turnovers, verify quality, and drive consistent performance.

- Monitor pricing and availability: check pricing rules are being applied, flag risks/opportunities, and escalate recommendations.

- Create and update listings: listing setup, copy accuracy, amenities, house rules, photo requirements, and platform compliance (
 as applicable).

- Maintain and improve SOPs: update processes based on recurring issues, guest feedback, and operational learnings.

Property project coordination (admin execution)

- Maintain a project tracker for tasks, owners, due dates, and blockers.

- Source and compare quotes: produce a quote comparison table and recommendation.

- Follow-up with contractors, suppliers, utilities, council, other professional, keep reference numbers, paper trail, and next-step ownership.

- Documentation: build/format/update project packs, submissions, and version control.

- Appointment scheduling: inspections, contractor visits, deliveries, surveys, and access coordination.

Reporting directly to company CEO



Tools and working style

- We use Lark for communication, tracking, and internal workflows.

- Google Drive for document storage and document control.

- PMS/pricing tools as applicable (Hostaway/PriceLabs or similar).



Must-have experience

- Evidence-based quality control: Create and used checklists/audits/photo evidence used to enforce standards and reduce recurring issues.

- Serviced accommodation or hospitality ops: guest comms + turnover coordination + issue resolution.

- Property management working experience

- Vendor/contractor coordination: proactive follow-up, scheduling, and timeline control.

- Strong written English: crisp guest messaging and concise leadership updates.

- SOP ownership: has maintained/improved SOPs based on operational reality, not just followed them.

Nice-to-have experience

- Listing creation and optimization (
).

- Pricing/availability monitoring and familiarity with revenue management tools (e.g., PriceLabs).

- Property management operations or refurb coordination admin.

Personality traits we’re looking for

- Conscientious and detail-accurate.

- Proactive follow-up and ownership mindset.

- Structured and process-driven (lives in checklists/trackers).

- Calm, professional, and solution-oriented with guests and vendors.

- Improves systems continuously rather than firefighting repeatedly.

- Well organised with multiple task and able to prioritise



Hiring process:

Step 1: Answer the Google link below (required) and follow the instructions after.

Step 2: Answer scenario based questions

Step 3: Join 20-minute screening call

Step 4: Paid trial task

Step 5: Final interview + references



HOW TO APPLY:



Click the link

I’ll be in touch with you in 3-5 working days.



Please note, we ONLY accept applications through this application process. PLEASE DO NOT use the website’s message board as we don’t monitor this.

title: Media Buyer
description:
We’re not looking for someone to just “run ads.”



We’re looking for a growth partner who knows how to turn cold traffic into profit.



This isn’t a button-clicking role. You’ll be engineering conversion ecosystems — from hook testing to funnel sequencing — across platforms like Meta, TikTok, YouTube, Native, and even emerging channels like NewsBreak and Reddit Ads.



If you live for testing, scaling, and making data + psychology work together, keep reading.



What You’ll Do :

1. Take campaigns from concept ? launch ? optimization ? scale — end to end.

2. Build testing matrices with hooks, formats, placements, and audiences.

3. Rapid-fire test short-form videos, statics, UGC, and carousel ads.

4. Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Motion, AdCreative.ai, Hyros, Triple Whale, etc.) to find winning angles faster.

5. Spot what drives CTR, CVR, and watch time — then double down.

6. Expand across channels with tailored creative logic (Meta for storytelling, TikTok for UGC, YouTube for scripted ads, Native for curiosity-driven traffic).



Who You Are :

- Analytical like an analyst, creative like a storyteller.

- Obsessed with data + psychology and how they produce performance.

- Confident managing 5–10 campaigns at once across accounts.

- Fluent in AI — you use it as a scaling weapon, not just a helper.

- You don’t just optimize ads; you build systems that others can follow.

- You feel responsible for profit, not just traffic.



Why This Role Matters :

- A weak media buyer spends budgets.

- A strong one builds a machine that self-optimizes with sharp creatives, clean tracking, and constant testing.



If you’re the kind of buyer who doesn’t ask, ‘What’s my budget?’ but instead, ‘How much can I spend profitably by tomorrow?’ — this is your stage.

title: Direct Response Marketing VA / Creative Ops Assistant
description:

2. Manage content libraries, version control, and naming conventions for hundreds of creatives.

3. Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Jasper, Midjourney, Runway) to generate ad ideas, creative briefs, and content variations.

4. Upload and organize campaigns to ensure all ads meet compliance, platform specifications, and tracking requirements.

5. Track creative performance daily and report on winning hooks, formats, and angles.

6. Brief designers, editors, and copywriters based on data insights and performance results.

7. Automate repetitive workflows and reports using tools like 
, Zapier, or Notion AI.

Requirements:

1. 1+ year experience in direct response marketing, media buying support, or creative operations.

2. Familiarity with ad platforms (Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads, or Native Ads).

3. Excellent organization and communication skills, able to coordinate multiple moving pieces.

4. Experience using AI tools (ChatGPT, Midjourney, Runway, Jasper) for content generation and creative ideation.

5. Strong understanding of direct response principles, including hooks, problem-agitation-solution, and curiosity-driven storytelling.

6. Attention to detail, time management, and ability to work independently in a fast-paced, remote environment.

7. Bonus: experience with ClickUp, Notion, or automation platforms (Zapier, 
).





To be CONSIDERED, send us the following:

1. Your resume, portfolio, or LinkedIn profile

2. Examples of campaigns or ad creatives you’ve managed or helped produce

3. (Optional) A short Loom video or note describing your workflow and AI tools you use daily

title: Accounts Specialist
description:
Application Process



Please submit your interest, cover letter, VC and a short 1-2 minute video introduction introducing yourself, recent experience and suitability for this role.



Accounts & Growth Specialist

Full-Time Role

Competitive Salary



We develop and deliver cutting-edge Visitor Management System (VMS) software through a Software as a Service (SaaS) model. Our platform helps organisations improve safety, compliance, security and operational efficiency across Australia and internationally.



About the Role



We are seeking a commercially minded and detail-oriented Accounts Specialist to manage and grow new and existing customer accounts.



This role blends account management, renewals, revenue optimisation, CRM administration, and customer growth strategy. You will play a key role in driving recurring revenue through renewals, identifying upsell and cross-sell opportunities, supporting payables processes, and ensuring CRM accuracy and reporting integrity.



Working closely with Sales, Customer Success, Finance, and Senior Management, you will help maximise customer lifetime value while maintaining strong operational discipline.



This is an ideal role for someone with at least 2 years’ experience in an IT or SaaS company who understands subscription-based revenue models and enjoys both relationship management and data-driven commercial analysis.



Key Responsibilities



Account Management & Renewals

- Manage a portfolio of new and existing customer accounts.

- Proactively manage subscription renewals to ensure strong retention rates.

- Monitor account health and engagement metrics to reduce churn risk.

- Act as a key point of contact for commercial account queries.

- Revenue Growth & Opportunity Development

- Identify and execute upsell and cross-sell opportunities across Teamgo’s product suite.

- Work with Sales and Senior Management to develop account growth strategies.

- Analyse usage data and customer behaviour to uncover expansion opportunities.

- Support proposal development and pricing discussions for account upgrades.



CRM & Data Management

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in the company CRM system.

- Ensure pipeline integrity and revenue forecasting accuracy.

- Perform regular data audits to maintain reporting accuracy.

- Generate reports for leadership on account performance and revenue metrics.



Financial & Administrative Support

- Support invoice follow-ups and coordinate with Finance on receivables and payables.

- Assist with subscription adjustments, contract updates, and billing queries.

- Ensure customer records align with contractual terms and commercial agreements.

- Assist in revenue reconciliation and account reporting processes.

- Cross-Functional Collaboration

- Work closely with the Sales team to transition new customers smoothly.

- Collaborate with Product and Support teams to identify account expansion pathways.

- Provide feedback to leadership on market trends and customer needs.

- Contribute to strategic initiatives focused on sustainable revenue growth.



Day-to-Day Activities

- Managing renewal reminders and commercial outreach.

- Reviewing account usage data and identifying growth triggers.

- Updating CRM records and maintaining pipeline visibility.

- Supporting pricing reviews and preparing customer proposals.

- Working with leadership on strategic account planning.

- Coordinating billing updates and resolving account queries.

- Assisting with revenue forecasting and reporting.



Qualifications & Experience



To succeed in this role, you will demonstrate strong commercial awareness combined with attention to detail and operational discipline.



Essential:

- Minimum 2 years’ experience in an Account Management, Accounts Specialist, or Customer Success role within an IT or SaaS company

- Experience managing subscription-based revenue models

- Strong CRM experience (HubSpot, Salesforce, Zoho, PipeDrive or similar)

- High attention to detail and strong data accuracy skills

- Experience managing renewals and revenue retention

- Strong communication and stakeholder management skills

- Proficiency in Google Workspace or Microsoft Office Suite



Highly Desirable:

- Experience in SaaS revenue operations or subscription billing environments

- Understanding of SaaS metrics (MRR, ARR, churn, LTV, CAC)

- Technical understanding of cloud software platforms

- Experience identifying upsell/cross-sell opportunities

- Knowledge of compliance-driven industries (government, education, enterprise)

- Commercial negotiation experience



Personal Attributes

- Commercially driven with a growth mindset

- Highly organised and process-oriented

- Strong analytical thinker

- Self-motivated and proactive

- Comfortable working both independently and collaboratively

- Passionate about technology and its impact on modern workplaces



Perks & Benefits



At Teamgo, we recognise our people are our greatest asset. As a growing SaaS company, we provide an environment where initiative and performance are rewarded.



You will receive:

- Competitive salary

- Flexible remote work arrangements

- Career progression opportunities within a scaling SaaS company

- Exposure to strategic revenue growth initiatives

- Ongoing training and professional development

- Opportunity to work in a fast-growing Australian technology company with international reach

title: Business Operations Coordinator (Executive VA)
description:
Location: Remote 

Role Type: High-Accountability / Direct Support to Creative Director



*** The Mission ***

I am the Creative Director of Engage Video Production (EVP). We create educational and communication-focused video content, primarily for aerospace, defense, and technical clients. Our work helps organizations explain complex ideas clearly, train teams effectively, and communicate with precision. Projects vary in scope and style.



About Engage Video Production: Our work helps organizations explain complex ideas clearly, train teams effectively, and communicate with precision. In this role, you are the glue that holds our operations together. Because we serve technical and defense-oriented clients, there is zero margin for error. You will be responsible for ensuring that my creative vision is met with operational excellence and that our team stays aligned.



*** Core Responsibilities ***

Production and Tasker Management: Ownership of the master company to-do list. You are responsible for keeping the Creative Director on track and accountable to deadlines.



Team Coordination: Act as the primary point of contact for our remote staff, including editors and crew. Coordinate their progress, ensure they have assets, and flag delays immediately.



Social Media Distribution: Post and schedule provided content across
, LinkedIn, and Instagram.



CRM and Lead Management: Move leads from LinkedIn or
 into our CRM with 100?curacy.



Analytics Tracking: Capture performance data and update internal trackers to inform business decisions.



*** Skills Requirements ***

Must-Have: Social Media Proficiency (Meta, LinkedIn, Instagram), CRM and Data Entry (Google Sheets/Excel), Task Management (Trello, Asana, or ClickUp), and Professional English Communication.



Nice-to-Have: Video Production Literacy, Lead Prospecting (LinkedIn Sales Navigator), and Basic Asset Management (Dropbox/Google Drive).



*** The Three Pillars of Success ***

Discipline: You follow through on every task, every time. You do not flounder or ghost.



Motivation and Dedication: You are dedicated to the success of the mission and the growth of the company.



Radical Integrity and Accountability: You own your mistakes immediately. We operate on a debrief culture: if I make a mistake or miss a task, I expect you to have the backbone to point it out so we can correct it together.



*** Growth, Mentorship, and Compensation ***

Direct Mentorship: Work directly with a 20+ year military veteran with deep experience in leadership and operations.



The Rising Tide Philosophy: "A rising tide lifts all boats" - My leadership style is built on the idea that a rising tide lifts all boats. If you demonstrate the discipline, motivation, and dedication to help this business succeed, your compensation, responsibility, and professional standing will grow along with it.



Salary (Part-Time): 20,000 PHP ($340 USD) - 30,000 PHP ($515) per month, for 20+ hours per week. (*Conversions are approximate)



Salary (Full-Time): 40,000 PHP ($680 USD) - 60,000 PHP ($1,000) per month, for 40+ hours per week. (*Conversions are approximate)



Rate Determination: Starting salary within the ranges above is dependent upon experience and skill.



Benefits: Pro-rated 13th-month bonus and paid technical training for proven tea
mbers.



*** How to Apply ***

Failure to follow these exact steps will result in immediate disqualification.



Step 1:  Your application message must use this exact subject line: Business Operations Coordinator - [Your Name] - Ready to Grow



Step 2: In your application message, please provide a response to the following:



Describe a specific time you had to manage a remote team or a time you had to keep a manager or client accountable to a schedule.



The Creative Director has a 20 year background in military leadership and the company serves aerospace and defense clients. Why are you a fit for a high accountability environment where precision and clear communication are the top priorities?



Step 3: Include a link to a short (2 minute) Loom or video introduction. In this video, briefly state your experience with CRM and Task Management, and confirm that you understand the Three Pillars (Discipline, Motivation/Dedication, and Radical Integrity/Accountability) required for this role.



Bonus Step (Optional) This step is not required, but it is an opportunity for those who want to stand out. Provide a separate, brief Loom video where you:



Identify one specific lead (a specific person and their job title) from a medium-sized business on LinkedIn that is an appropriate client for EVP.



Explain how you found them and why that specific individual is the right person for me to reach out to.



Explain why their company is a good lead for our specific niche in aerospace, defense, or technical communications.

title: Video Editor (Junior to Senior Level) – Paid, Flexible, Project-Based
description:
Company: Engage Video Production

Compensation: Paid (rate based on experience, skill set, and performance)

Hours: Flexible | Project-based (estimated 10–40 hours per week)



About Engage Video Production



Engage Video Production creates educational and communication-focused video content for aerospace, defense, technology, and other professional industries. Our work spans training, onboarding, internal communications, marketing, and technical storytelling.



While aerospace and defense are a core specialty, projects vary widely in subject matter and format. Editors must be adaptable and comfortable shifting styles depending on the client and goals of each project.



The Role



We are seeking a Video Editor at either the junior or senior level, depending on experience. This is a paid role with active projects already queued, not a speculative or “learning-only” internship.



The ideal candidate is someone who can:

Edit independently with minimal supervision

Communicate clearly and proactively

Collaborate with other freelancers or tea
mbers when required

Adapt to different project scopes, styles, and timelines

Senior-level candidates must demonstrate both strong technical skill and a proven work ethic.



Core Responsibilities



Edit short- and long-form video content for client projects

Work primarily in DaVinci Resolve (preferred)

Organize, sync, and manage large volumes of footage

Perform color correction and color grading on all deliverables

Apply motion graphics, titles, and lower thirds as needed

Integrate music, sound design, and basic audio cleanup

Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed-upon deadlines

Coordinate with the Creative Director and, when applicable, other editors or freelancers



Required Qualifications



Demonstrated experience editing video (freelance, professional, or equivalent)

Proficiency in DaVinci Resolve (strongly preferred)

Experience with Adobe Premiere Pro or other NLEs is acceptable if you aren't comfortable working in Resolve



Solid understanding of:

Editing pacing and storytelling

Audio cleanup and mixing

Color correction and grading workflows

Export settings and professional delivery formats

Ability to work independently without micromanagement

Excellent communication skills

Must be proactive about timelines, challenges, progress, and feedback

Reliable, high-speed internet connection

You will regularly receive hundreds of gigabytes to terabytes of footage



Bonus / Preferred Skills



Motion graphics experience (After Effects, Fusion, or equivalent)

Graphic design skills (image creation, maps, diagrams, simple layouts, visual explainers)

Experience with educational, corporate, or technical content

Familiarity with structured feedback and client-facing revisions

Interest in aerospace, defense, science, or complex subject matter



Hours & Workload



Workload will vary by project and skill level

Estimated range: 10–40 hours per week

As project volume increases and clients are satisfied, hours and responsibility can scale accordingly



Working Style



This role requires minimal supervision

Clear communication is essential

If timelines need to shift or challenges arise, they must be communicated early

Flexibility and adaptability are critical, as projects and team structures may change



When applying, please include:



-A brief introduction

-Your relevant experience or resume

-A link to your portfolio or recent editing samples (required)

title: Part time PPC Manager (Google & Bing Ads)
description:
Role Overview:

We are seeking an experienced PPC Manager to lead the development, execution, and optimization of paid search campaigns across both Google Ads and Bing Ads. The ideal candidate will have a hands-on understanding of both platforms and proven success managing large-scale, complex campaigns with significant budgets. You will be responsible for delivering results-driven campaigns that align with client goals while maintaining a deep understanding of industry best practices. Previous experience working at Google or a strong insider knowledge of Google Ads best practices is highly advantageous.

As a PPC Manager, you’ll be the go-to expert for all things paid search and will have a direct impact on client performance. The role requires a strategic mindset, data-driven decision-making, and the ability to maintain clear and effective communication with both internal teams and clients.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Paid Search Strategy & Execution:

Campaign Development & Management: Develop, launch, and manage paid search campaigns on Google Ads and Bing Ads, ensuring they are aligned with client objectives and maximize ROI. This includes campaigns on Google Search, Display, YouTube, Shopping, and Bing Search.

Keyword Research & Audience Targeting: Conduct extensive keyword research, competitor analysis, and audience segmentation to identify growth opportunities. Develop comprehensive strategies based on these insights to optimize targeting and bidding.

Campaign Optimization: Continuously analyze and refine campaigns to improve performance metrics such as CPC, CTR, CPA, and ROAS. Implement A/B testing strategies for ad creatives, landing pages, and bidding strategies to maximize conversions.

Ad Copy & Creative Strategy: Work closely with the creative team to ensure that ad copy, creatives, and landing pages are optimized for user engagement and aligned with campaign goals.

2. Client Communication & Consultation:

Client Liaison: Serve as the main point of contact for clients, providing expert consultation on all Google Ads and Bing Ads strategies. Clearly communicate campaign progress, adjustments, and results to ensure client satisfaction and alignment with business objectives.

Performance Reporting: Regularly prepare and present in-depth performance reports, including key performance metrics (CPC, CTR, CPA, ROAS) and actionable insights. Use these reports to showcase campaign successes and provide strategic recommendations for optimization.

Strategic Guidance: Offer strategic recommendations to clients, advising on how to improve campaign performance, expand reach, or address performance challenges. Proactively identify opportunities for growth.

Client Relationship Management: Build and nurture strong relationships with clients, becoming a trusted advisor on paid search and digital marketing. Ensure high levels of client satisfaction, resolve campaign-related issues, and manage client expectations effectively.

3. Budget Management & Performance Tracking:

Budget Oversight: Manage and optimize client budgets across both Google Ads and Bing Ads to ensure campaigns are efficient and within budget. Track and report on budget pacing and ensure that client goals are met while maximizing ROI.

Performance Tracking & Analysis: Utilize Google Analytics, Microsoft Advertising Intelligence, Google Tag Manager, and other analytics platforms to monitor campaign performance in real time. Assess KPIs such as CPC, CTR, CPA, and ROAS to ensure campaigns are delivering results within the defined parameters.

Optimization: Make data-driven decisions to optimize campaigns for better performance. Adjust bids, keywords, targeting, and ads based on performance trends and competitive insights.

4. Collaboration & Cross-Functional Alignment:

Team Collaboration: Work closely with the broader digital marketing team (SEO, Social Media, Creative, Web Development) to ensure that PPC campaigns are integrated into wider marketing and sales strategies. Align campaigns with broader business objectives, ensuring a cohesive approach across all digital channels.

Stakeholder Coordination: Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure paid search efforts align with company goals and support sales or product launch strategies.

Knowledge Sharing: Actively contribute to knowledge-sharing within the marketing team by educating peers about PPC best practices, emerging trends, and new tools or features in Google Ads and Bing Ads.

5. Industry Trend Awareness & Innovation:

Stay Current with PPC Trends: Stay up-to-date with the latest Google Ads and Bing Ads updates, features, and best practices. Attend webinars, conferences, and industry events to keep ahead of emerging trends and leverage new opportunities for clients.

Test New Strategies: Continuously evaluate and experiment with new tools, bidding strategies, and ad formats to ensure campaigns are always optimized and competitive. Propose new strategies to clients based on these findings.

6. Reporting & Data-Driven Insights:

Regular Reporting: Create and maintain regular performance reports, dashboards, and presentations to track campaign progress, analyze performance trends, and showcase ROI. Present these findings in a clear, concise manner to clients and internal teams.

Actionable Insights: Translate complex data into actionable insights that drive campaign improvements. Provide clear, data-backed recommendations to both internal and client stakeholders to guide future PPC strategies and decisions.

Attribution & Conversion Tracking: Implement and manage proper tracking systems to measure campaign effectiveness and provide accurate reporting on conversions, revenue, and other key metrics.



Qualifications:

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience). Certifications in Google Ads and Bing Ads are a plus.



Experience:

Proven PPC Experience: Minimum of 3–5 years of hands-on experience managing PPC campaigns across Google Ads and Bing Ads. This includes experience in Google Search, Display, YouTube, Shopping, and Bing Search campaigns.

Agency or Client Experience: Experience working in a client-facing role, ideally in a digital marketing agency, managing multiple PPC accounts with large-scale budgets.

Experience at Google (Bonus): Previous experience working at Google or within a Google Partner agency is highly desirable, particularly if you have in-depth knowledge of Google Ads best practices, new features, and insights from working directly with the platform.



Technical Skills:

Google Ads & Bing Ads Expertise: Advanced proficiency in managing campaigns across Google Ads and Bing Ads, including search, display, shopping, remarketing, and video campaigns.

Analytics Tools Proficiency: Strong working knowledge of Google Analytics, Microsoft Advertising Intelligence, Google Tag Manager, and other relevant analytics and tracking tools to measure, report, and optimize PPC campaign performance.

Data Interpretation: Ability to analyze large datasets, interpret complex data, and turn insights into actionable strategies to optimize campaign performance.



Soft Skills:

Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills: Ability to explain complex PPC strategies and performance data in a clear, concise, and accessible manner for clients, internal teams, and stakeholders.

Client Management Experience: Proven experience in building and nurturing strong client relationships. Ability to manage client expectations and resolve issues in a timely and professional manner.

Problem-Solving & Proactive Mindset: Strong problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing campaign issues. Ability to think critically and take strategic action based on data.

Attention to Detail: High attention to detail, ensuring that campaign elements are precise and accurately reflect client objectives, even when working with large volumes of data.



How to Apply:

If you’re an experienced PPC Manager looking for a new challenge, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume, along with a cover letter outlining your relevant experience. Include any specific campaigns or achievements that highlight your expertise with Google Ads and Bing Ads.

description:

ntum

title: Senior Java Developer (E-commerce)
description:
About the Job:  We are seeking an accomplished Senior Java Developer to drive the development and optimization of our e-commerce platform. The ideal candidate will bring extensive experience in Java, microservices architecture, and performance tuning, along with the leadership skills to mentor a growing development team and steer complex projects to success.



Key Responsibilities

Application Design & Development



Architect, design, and develop high-performance, scalable Java-based e-commerce applications.

Implement microservices and event-driven architectures to ensure modular and resilient systems.

Performance Optimization & Scalability



Monitor, analyze, and optimize system performance, memory usage, and throughput.

Troubleshoot concurrency, threading, and performance bottlenecks using advanced profiling tools and techniques.

Technical Leadership



Mentor junior and mid-level developers, setting best practices in coding, testing, and deployment.

Drive architectural decisions and technology choices aligned with business needs and industry standards.

System Integration



Integrate third-party APIs, payment gateways, and services to enhance platform capabilities.

Implement caching solutions (e.g., Redis, Memcached) and messaging systems (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka) for efficient data handling.

Quality Assurance & Testing



Champion test-driven development (TDD) and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD).

Write and maintain robust unit, integration, and end-to-end tests using frameworks such as JUnit, TestNG, and Mockito.

DevOps & Deployment



Collaborate with DevOps teams to automate builds, deployments, and monitoring (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, Docker, Kubernetes).

Ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and seamless scalability in production environments.

Security & Compliance



Enforce secure coding practices, including data encryption, OAuth/JWT-based authentication, and compliance with PCI-DSS/GDPR where applicable.

Continuously monitor and mitigate security vulnerabilities and threats.

Documentation & Collaboration



Produce clear, comprehensive technical documentation and architectural diagrams.

Work cross-functionally with product managers, QA, UX designers, and other engineers to deliver robust solutions within agile sprints.

Continuous Improvement



Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and technologies to evolve and enhance our software development lifecycle.

Propose and implement improvements to optimize code quality, productivity, and operational efficiency.



Note: Please send a link to your updated CV with appropriate sharing access, failure to comply will not move forward with the application.



Qualifications:



5+ years of professional Java development experience, ideally on large-scale e-commerce or SaaS platforms.

Demonstrated success in building and deploying microservices, distributed systems, and event-driven architectures.

Technical Expertise



Java Proficiency: Strong command of Java 8+ features (Streams, Lambdas), concurrency, memory management, and JVM internals.

Frameworks & Libraries: Advanced experience with Spring Boot, Spring Data, Spring Security, Hibernate/JPA.

API & Integrations: Experience creating RESTful APIs, integrating third-party services, and working with GraphQL (preferred).

Database Systems: Hands-on experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB; adept at writing complex queries and optimizing database performance.

Messaging & Caching: Practical knowledge of message brokers (RabbitMQ, Kafka) and caching systems (Redis, Memcached).

Build & CI/CD: Proficiency in Maven/Gradle, Git, Jenkins/GitLab CI, Docker, and Kubernetes for seamless development and deployment.

Testing: Expertise in TDD, unit testing, integration testing, and test automation frameworks like JUnit, TestNG, and Mockito.

Performance Monitoring & Profiling: Familiarity with tools like VisualVM, YourKit, or New Relic for troubleshooting and tuning.

Soft Skills



Leadership: Demonstrated ability to mentor developers and influence technical direction.

Collaboration: Excellent communication skills, capable of working effectively with product owners, designers, and cross-functional teams.

Adaptability: Thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment, reacting quickly to changing requirements.

Problem-Solving: Proven analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solving complex challenges.



***Very Important: Do take note that the applicant is required to share their updated CV with appropriate access. Applicants who are non compliant with this will be automatically ignored.***

title: Long-form, Experienced Copywriter
description:
I’m looking for an experienced copywriter to write a script for a single YouTube-style video, approximately 20 minutes long.



This is for a growing brand in the men's health niche. 



This is a one-off project with a fixed scope and budget. The goal is a script that’s clear, engaging, and easy to follow. Think conversational and smart, not salesy or overproduced.



What you’ll be doing:



Writing a complete script for a ~20-minute video (roughly 2,500–3,000 words)

Structuring the content so it flows naturally and keeps attention



What I’ll provide:



The topic and core angle

Key points that need to be covered

Context on the audience and purpose of the video



You don’t need to appear on camera. This is script-only work.



Who this is a good fit for:



You have experience writing long-form content or video scripts

You understand pacing and structure for YouTube-style videos

You’re comfortable taking direction but can think independently



Budget:



€500 fixed fee for this one script

Payment on completion



How to apply:



Send 2 relevant writing samples (video scripts or long-form content preferred)

Include a short note on how you’d approach writing a 20-minute video like this, including all the steps you usually follow to write a successful video.

title: GoHighLevel Technical Support (Chat Focused)
description:
Location: Remote

Role Type: Part-Time (approx. 20 hours/week)

Shifts Available (All times in ET):



9:00 AM – 1:00 PM Monday-Friday

11:30 AM – 3:30 PM Monday-Friday

6:00 PM – 10:00 PM Monday-Friday

4:00 PM - 11:00 PM Saturday and Sunday



ABOUT TAFT SYSTEMS

Taft Systems is a white-label backend fulfillment powerhouse. We handle the heavy lifting—CRM setups, automations, and technical execution—for marketing agencies under their own brand. We’re a "small but mighty" team focused on helping agency owners scale without the delivery chaos.



THE ROLE

We are looking for four HighLevel experts to join our team as Technical Support Specialists. This isn’t a typical "answer and pass" role; you will be on the front lines, helping our clients solve technical puzzles in real-time. Your main focus will be managing live chat support, ensuring every client feels heard and every issue is resolved cleanly.



WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Live Chat Support: Be the primary point of contact for clients on chat, managing up to 3 simultaneous conversations with ease and accuracy.

Independent Troubleshooting: Confidently navigate the HighLevel platform to diagnose and fix issues related to workflows, funnels, CRM settings, and more without needing a hand-to-hold.

Platform Maintenance: Perform light Technical VA work within the HighLevel platform to support ongoing client builds and account health.

White-Label Excellence: Deliver support that aligns with the white-label nature of our business, understanding that our work represents our clients' brands.

Problem Solving: Dive deep into technical issues and enjoy the process of "figuring it out" for a client.



WHAT YOU BRING:

HighLevel Mastery: 1+ years of hands-on experience inside HighLevel (GHL). You know the platform inside and out.

Certification: Ideally, you are HighLevel Certified (or have equivalent deep-bench experience).

Chat Prowess: Ability to stay organized and friendly while multitasking across multiple chats.

Detail Oriented: Love paying attention to details and actually hear what the client is asking. To show an example of this, please put the word smile in the subject line. 

Independence: You’re a self-starter who can find solutions independently and take ownership of technical issues.

Passion for Support: You actually like helping people and get a win out of solving a tricky technical problem

Camera Ready: We provide Loom videos and daily office hours to our clients and we need someone who is camera ready with great English. 



WHY JOIN US?

100% Remote: Work from anywhere.

Focus & Flow: Structured shifts that allow you to focus on your work and then get on with your day.

Growth: Be part of a fast-growing team that is obsessed with building clean, client-ready systems.

Pay & Benefits: We provide competitive salaries, paid time off, bonuses, and room for growth within the company

title: AI Video Creator & Editor (Full-Time | Remote | Philippines)
description:
We’re hiring fast.  Immediate start required. Long-term work for the right person.

We are a small, high-performance team based in the Philippines.

We build revenue systems that move belief before money moves.



Our brands — FlameFunnels + B2B Growth Systems — publish high-impact B2B content daily, blending strategy, buyer psychology, and high-velocity execution.



Now we need a dedicated, AI-savvy video creator/editor to turn written content into scroll-breaking short-form videos across multiple platforms.



YOUR ROLE



As our AI Video Creator & Editor, you will:

	•	Turn long-form copy into short, sharp video content

	•	Use AI tools to generate professional, human-like visuals

	•	Add captions, kinetic text, animations, and visual effects

	•	Edit for platform-specific formats (LinkedIn,
, Threads, Instagram, YouTube Shorts)

	•	Collaborate weekly with the founder + strategist

	•	Deliver 10–20 short videos per week

	•	Match brand tone: serious, precise, scroll-stopping — not generic templates or 
 edits



 TOOLS YOU SHOULD KNOW (or equivalent)



We’ll provide tool access — but if you have better ones, use them.

What matters is quality and speed.



Suggested stack:

	•	RunwayML — AI video editing / motion tools

	•	Pictory, InVideo, Synthesia — turning text into video

	•	Descript — voice editing / captions

	•	CapCut, VN, Premiere Pro — polishing + platform formatting

	•	Canva Pro — overlays / branded elements



You don’t need to know them all — but you must already be using AI-powered tools for video creation. We won’t train from scratch.



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

	•	Strong video editing + AI workflow experience

	•	Can generate realistic, human-like videos — not just slideshows

	•	Understands platform dynamics + how to hook attention

	•	Excellent English comprehension

	•	Attention to detail — visually and rhythmically

	•	Reliable, self-directed, no handholding

	•	Available in PH timezone



?



SALARY & GROWTH



This is a new arm of the business.

We are starting lean — but this role will grow fast as we scale.



We want you to get paid well. The more we grow, the more you earn.

We value loyalty, speed, and precision.



HOW TO APPLY



When applying, include:

	1.	Your AI video editing experience

	2.	Why you want this role

	3.	3 examples of your best video work (portfolio or links)

	•	Bonus if AI-assisted or short-form for business content

	4.	Working hours (PH timezone)

	5.	Monthly salary expectation (USD)

	6.	(Optional but powerful) A short voice note introduction



If you’re ready to help us cut through the noise and build scroll-dominant systems…



Apply now.

title: Virtual Assistant – Agentic AI Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
About the Client



This client is a forward-thinking, systems-driven business focused on using AI agents and automation to improve efficiency, decision-making, and scalability. They value practical execution, clear documentation, and repeatable systems over experimental or hype-driven AI use.



The goal is to build AI agents that can operate semi-independently, support workflows, and reduce manual effort—while remaining transparent, reliable, and easy for the team to manage.



Role Overview



We are seeking an Agentic AI Specialist to design, build, and maintain AI-driven agents and workflows that can perform multi-step tasks with minimal supervision. This role is ideal for someone who understands how to move beyond single prompts into goal-oriented AI systems that can plan, execute, and iterate within defined guardrails.



The VA will work closely with leadership to translate business needs into functional AI agents, document how they work, and ensure they remain reliable and aligned with business goals.



Core Responsibilities



Design and implement agentic AI workflows that can complete multi-step tasks independently or semi-independently



Build and refine AI agents for operations, research, content workflows, data organization, or internal support



Define goals, constraints, and decision logic for AI agents to ensure safe and predictable execution



Create and maintain prompt frameworks, memory structures, and tool usage logic for agents



Monitor agent performance, review outputs, and continuously improve reliability and efficiency



Document AI agent workflows, logic, and usage guidelines for team adoption



Collaborate with stakeholders to identify tasks suitable for agent-based automation



Ensure responsible use of AI, including data privacy, accuracy checks, and human-in-the-loop controls



Required Qualifications / Skills



Hands-on experience with agentic AI concepts (multi-step reasoning, tool use, task planning)



Strong understanding of prompt chaining, task decomposition, and workflow design



Experience using Generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT or similar) beyond basic prompting



Ability to translate business goals into structured AI systems



Strong documentation skills and clear written communication



Organized, analytical, and comfortable testing and iterating



Preferred / Bonus Skills



Experience with AI agent frameworks or orchestration tools



Familiarity with automation, APIs, or no-code/low-code platforms



Experience building internal tools or AI-powered assistants



Understanding of AI limitations, error handling, and safety best practices



Work Schedule & Time Zone



Part-Time (hours to be confirmed)



U.S. business hours preferred



Flexible schedule based on deliverables and collaboration needs



Closing Statement



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys building intelligent systems that actually get work done. If you like turning complex processes into reliable AI-driven workflows and enjoy improving systems over time, this is a great opportunity to make a real impact.



Application Instructions



To apply, please submit your updated resume along with a 60–90 second self-introduction video sharing your experience and examples of AI agents or workflows you’ve built or supported. Only valid applications submitted within 48–72 hours of this posting will be entertained.



Application Name: Agentic AI Specialist

title: Meta Retargeting Specialist (Shopify) - WFO ONLY - Accomodation Available
description:
About Us:

AlgoGroup is building a pet-focused platform combining distribution, e-commerce, and veterinary-led trust. We’re moving fast and hiring a small founding team — people who take ownership, execute with high standards, and care about measurable results. If you want to be early in a team where your work has visible impact (and where you’ll learn quickly), you’ll fit in here.



A) About the role



We operate two established pet businesses:



(i) a Shopify e-commerce platform, and

(ii) a veterinary clinic.



Both have 10+ years of customer history and a deep base of warm customers. Our growth strategy is simple: aggressively retarget warm audiences (not broad discovery). A large portion of our customer database is WhatsApp-first (phone numbers, limited
).



Your job is to turn our customer lists (WhatsApp /
 exports) + website visitors into a disciplined Meta 
 engine across
, Instagram, and WhatsApp that drives measurable purchases and voucher redemptions.



B) Work arrangement: 

Work From Office (Philippines). We are near Pasig. Accomodation Can Be Provided. 



C) What you will own (core responsibilities)



1. Meta retargeting engine (primary)

i. Build and manage Meta 
 campaigns across
 / Instagram / WhatsApp inventory

ii. Create and maintain Custom Audiences from customer lists (especially WhatsApp phone lists) and segment them (active, lapsed, high-LTV, etc.)

iii. Build behavior-based audiences (7/14/30 day visitors, ViewContent/ATC/IC, etc.) + exclusions (purchasers, recent redeemers)

iv. Set up clean retargeting structure: sequencing, windows, frequency control, suppression

v. Run Dynamic Product Ads / catalog retargeting where appropriate (Shopify)



2. Tracking & measurement (critical)

i. Ensure Meta Pixel + CAPI works properly on Shopify (event QA: ViewContent / AddToCart / InitiateCheckout / Purchase)

ii. Enforce UTM discipline for all WhatsApp/email links and paid ads

iii. Maintain a simple weekly performance report (spend, purchases, ROAS/MER as applicable, CPA, top audiences/creatives, key learnings, next actions)



3. What we are NOT looking for

i. Awareness/discovery campaign focus

ii. “Growth hacker” generalist

iii. SEO/content role



This is a performance + tracking role focused on warm audiences and retargeting.



D) Requirements (must-have)



i. 2+ years running Meta retargeting for e-commerce (Shopify preferred)

ii. Hands-on experience with Meta Pixel + CAPI

iii. Strong with Custom Audiences from phone-based lists (formatting, segmentation, exclusions)

iv. Understands Meta placements/inventory across FB/IG/WhatsApp and can explain when/why to use each

v. Can communicate clearly with an internal ops team (Shopify/funnel work handled internally)



E) Other Attributes

i. Dynamic Product Ads / product catalogs

ii. GA4/GTM familiarity (enough to QA UTMs and funnel flow)

iii. Google remarketing experience (bonus only)

title: Vacation Rental Operations Coordinator
description:
Operations Coordinator – Vacation Rental Management (Full-Time Remote)



Boutique Vacation Rental Management Company



================================================================================



IMPORTANT: HOW TO APPLY



You MUST apply using this Google Form link:





Applications submitted any other way (including through OnlineJobs.ph messaging,
, or direct contact) will NOT be considered.



Only candidates who complete the full application form will be reviewed.



================================================================================



About Our Company



We are a boutique vacation rental management company specializing in high-end coastal properties. We manage approximately 45-51 luxury vacation homes for discerning second-home owners and provide exceptional guest experiences throughout the year.



We pride ourselves on combining professional property management with cutting-edge technology and AI-powered tools to deliver outstanding service while maintaining operational efficiency.



================================================================================



Position Overview



We are seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented, and dependable Operations Coordinator to serve as the central hub for our daytime operations. This is a full-time remote position working during U.S. Eastern Time business hours.



You will be the primary point of contact for guest communications, vendor coordination, and operational task management during the day. This role requires someone who is exceptionally responsive, maintains high accuracy across multiple software platforms, and thrives in a structured, process-driven environment.



This is NOT a job where you can "learn as you go" with basic English. We need someone with excellent written and spoken English who can represent our brand professionally in all guest and vendor communications.



================================================================================



Key Responsibilities



GUEST & LEAD COMMUNICATIONS

- Respond promptly (within 1 hour during business hours) to guest inquiries through Guesty and Breezeway using approved messaging templates

- Monitor Zillow Rental Manager for inbound rental inquiries and respond with appropriate information and next steps

- Document all guest interactions and escalate to management when necessary

- Maintain professional, friendly, and brand-appropriate communication at all times



VENDOR & SUBCONTRACTOR COORDINATION

- Communicate with cleaners, maintenance vendors, and service providers to confirm scheduling and work completion

- Update Breezeway with confirmation notes, delays, or completion status

- Track vendor reliability and flag performance issues

- Follow up consistently to ensure all tasks are completed on time



SUPPLY MANAGEMENT & ORDERING

- Research and compare pricing for linens and supplies across multiple vendors (Amazon, Walmart, local suppliers)

- Track orders and delivery timelines

- Maintain property supply levels using Notion and QR-code-based inventory submissions



SCHEDULING & TASK MANAGEMENT

- Verify property availability in Guesty before confirming service appointments

- Schedule maintenance, deep cleans, inspections, and recurring operational tasks

- Ensure all confirmed work is accurately reflected in shared calendars and dashboards



DAILY REPORTING & DOCUMENTATION

- Confirm completion of daily cleaning and maintenance tasks

- Upload photos, invoices, and completion notes into appropriate systems

- Identify outstanding or overdue items and report to management



================================================================================



Software & Tools You'll Use Daily



Property Management: Guesty (guest communication and booking visibility)

Field Operations: Breezeway (task tracking and vendor coordination)

Project Management: Notion (task management, onboarding, inventory)

Lead Management: Zillow Rental Manager (rental inquiry management)

Communication: OpenPhone (SMS and call coordination)

Office Tools: Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Calendar)

Ordering: Amazon, Walmart, Local Vendors (supply and linen purchasing)



================================================================================



Required Qualifications



CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS (Non-Negotiable)



COMMUNICATION SKILLS:

- Excellent written English – You will write to guests and property owners daily. Poor grammar or unclear writing is not acceptable.

- Excellent spoken English – You will occasionally handle phone calls with guests, vendors, and tea
mbers. Clear communication is essential.

- Native or near-native English proficiency required



WORK STYLE:

- Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail

- Extremely responsive – You must respond to messages quickly and follow through without reminders

- Process-oriented – You follow established procedures and document your work thoroughly

- Tech-savvy – You learn new software quickly and use multiple platforms simultaneously without confusion



AI & TECHNOLOGY:

- Comfortable with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.) and actively use them to improve work efficiency

- Quick to adopt new technology rather than resist it



AVAILABILITY:

- Able to work 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM Eastern Time (Philippine time: approximately 11:00 PM – 7:00 AM)

- In-season schedule (April-October): Saturday–Tuesday workdays, Wednesday-Thursday off

- Off-season schedule (November-March): Monday–Friday workdays, weekends off

- This is your ONLY job – no other employment or side work during these hours



OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

- Comfortable with computer remote monitoring software during work hours

- Stable internet connection and professional home workspace

- Own computer (laptop or desktop)



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

- Prior experience in vacation rental management, hospitality, or property coordination

- Experience with property management systems (Guesty, Hostaway, OwnerRez, etc.)

- Experience coordinating with remote or field-based teams

- Familiarity with Google Workspace, Notion, or similar tools



================================================================================



What We Offer



- Competitive hourly rate (to be discussed based on experience)

- Paid training period to learn our systems and processes

- Performance-based bonuses potential

- Growth opportunities within the company

- Structured work environment with clear processes and expectations

- Modern tech stack with AI-powered tools

- Professional development in U.S.-based vacation rental management



================================================================================



Work Schedule Details



Standard Hours: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM Eastern Time (8 hours/day)



In-Season (April through October):

- Work days: Saturday, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday

- Days off: Wednesday, Thursday (+ Friday)



Off-Season (November through March):

- Work days: Monday–Friday

- Days off: Saturday, Sunday



Note for Philippine-based applicants: Due to time zone differences, Eastern Time working hours will be late evening/overnight in the Philippines. Please ensure this schedule works for you before applying.



================================================================================



Ideal Candidate Profile



You are the RIGHT FIT for this role if you:



- Are obsessively organized and never let details slip through the cracks

- Respond to messages quickly and consistently follow through

- Write and speak English at a professional, native-level standard

- Learn new software in hours, not weeks

- Thrive on routine, checklists, and structured processes

- Use AI tools regularly to work more efficiently

- Are comfortable working independently with minimal supervision

- Take pride in accuracy and completing tasks to perfection

- Remain calm under pressure and handle multiple priorities simultaneously



You are NOT the RIGHT FIT if you:



- Need reminders to respond or follow up

- Struggle with grammar or professional writing

- Get frustrated by repetitive tasks or detailed tracking

- Prefer creative, big-picture work over operational execution

- Are uncomfortable with multiple software platforms

- Need flexible or variable work hours

- Want to work multiple jobs simultaneously



================================================================================



How to Apply



STEP 1: Complete the full application form at this link:





The application will take approximately 15-20 minutes to complete thoroughly. Please answer all questions honestly and completely.



STEP 2: We will review all applications and invite top candidates to record a video introduction (instructions will be provided).



STEP 3: Final candidates will be invited for a live video interview.



================================================================================



FINAL REMINDER



You MUST apply using this link:





- Do NOT send your resume through OnlineJobs.ph messaging

- Do NOT
 us directly

- Do NOT contact us on social media or other platforms



Only applications submitted through the Google Form will be considered.



Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. We will begin interviewing candidates as soon as we receive qualified applications, so please apply as soon as possible if you are interested.



================================================================================

title: Content Creator (email + social media)
description:
Job Title: Content Creator & Marketing Graphics Specialist (Part-Time)

About the Role

We’re looking for a creative, self-sufficient designer to join the Taft Systems team! You’ll be the one bringing our content to life across multiple brands. We provide the captions and the tools; you provide the eye for design and the hands to get it scheduled.



This is a part-time role to start (with a definite path to full-time for the right person) and requires you to be online and available during our core window of 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM ET.



WHAT YOU'LL DO



Create Graphics: Design everything from Reels and static social posts to
 headers and flyers using Canva.

Work Across Brands: You’ll handle assets for various brands, ensuring everything stays on-point and consistent (all brand assets provided).

Manage Scheduling: Use HighLevel to schedule social media posts and send out
s. (If you don’t know HighLevel yet, no worries—you just need to be ready to learn it!)

Iterate & Improve: Take feedback, make updates, and keep things moving independently.



WHO YOU ARE:



Canva Pro: You know your way around Canva and can produce high-quality, clean designs quickly.

Independent: You don’t need your hand held. You see a task, you handle it.

Willing to Learn: You’re excited to dive into HighLevel and master the scheduling side of things.

Creative & Coachable: You have a great eye for design but are also happy to tweak things based on team feedback.

Reliable: You’re available and focused during the 9 AM – 1 PM ET window.

Detail Oriented: You pay attention to detail, love helping clients and add the word pixel to your subject line when applying. 



Bonus Points

Experience with funnel design (not a requirement, but definitely a plus!).



WHY TAFT SYSTEMS:



Competitive Pay: We value your talent and pay accordingly.

Growth Potential: This role starts part-time, but there is huge room for growth within the company and a path to a full-time position.

Benefits: We offer paid time off (PTO) and performance-based bonuses.

Ownership: We’re a fast-growing team and we love people who take initiative and own their role.

title: UGC Video Editor | Performance Ad Creative for Meta Ads
description:
Remote | Full-Time Subcontractor | Fast-Paced | Long-Term Role



We are Dominate Next, a performance marketing agency based in Scotland. We help DTC brands in the UK, US, and Australia scale through Meta ads.



We are hiring a UGC Video Editor who can turn raw creator footage into scroll-stopping ads that convert. This is not a “make it pretty” role. It is about pacing, clarity, rhythm, and retention.



What you will do

- Edit short-form UGC ads for Meta 
 and Instagram).

- Create ~10 short-form videos per week (with variations).

- Add native-feeling captions, on-screen text, simple motion, and sound design.

- Build multiple versions fast: different hooks, pacing, shots.

- Take feedback daily and iterate quickly.

- Keep edits aligned to the supplied brief.

- Work closely with the rest of our team.





What we need from you

Must-haves

- Very proficient in CapCut (this is our preferred workflow).

- Strong sense of rhythm, flow, and timing.

- Sharp attention to detail: captions, cuts, pacing, audio levelling.

- Strong English communication (written and spoken).

- Experience editing UGC, TikTok/Reels, or paid social ads (at least 1 year).

- Reliable internet and delivery.



Big plus

- You have edited direct-response e-commerce ads for Meta.

- You understand performance creative basics.

- You can repurpose footage into new angles without being spoon-fed.



Working setup

- Full-time role (remote).

- 8 hours per day, including a 1-hour break.

- Fast-paced environment with direct feedback and clear standards.

- Long-term position if you perform.



Pay

- $700 to $950 USD per month, depending on experience, speed, and quality.



How to apply (read carefully) - Applications that do not follow this will be ignored.

Please include:

- Your portfolio (Your best UGC / paid social ad edits).

- Your Editing experience (how long, what type of work).

- Your internet speed test.

- Add the word “TARTAN” at the end of your application so we know you read this.



Do not send generic reels, cinematic edits, or long-form work unless it includes paid social examples. If you do not have UGC or ad samples, this is not the right role.



If you want a stable, long-term editing role where your work gets tested in real ad accounts with millions in spend, and you can level up fast, apply now.

title: Executive Assistant – (Immediate Fill Position)
description:
Long-term role. Big potential

Executive Assistant (Remote, Full-Time)



Full-Time | Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–5:00 PM EST



Apply here



Join an established USA-based company as an Executive Assistant supporting an Executive in a fast-paced, high-demand environment. This role requires a proactive “to-do” attitude—candidates must take initiative rather than wait to be told what to do. This is a full-time, hands-on role requiring real-time communication and active engagement throughout the day. Limited training will be provided, so the ideal candidate must be self-starting and resourceful.



The Executive Assistant will support the Executive with all assigned tasks, ensuring smooth operations across administrative, financial, HR, and project-related areas.



__________



What You’ll Do:



Provide day-to-day support, manage calendars, meetings, travel, and daily priorities.



Draft and manage
s, proposals, and follow-ups; communicate professionally with clients, vendors, contractors, and employees across the company in real time.



Assist with billing, purchase orders, invoicing, and financial tracking.



Support HR tasks including onboarding and workers’ compensation documentation.



Monitor and update project boards, track deadlines, and organize files, templates, and SOPs.



Conduct data analysis and support special projects with a proactive approach.



Assist with any additional tasks assigned by the Executive, adapting to changing priorities as needed.



__________



What We’re Looking For:



Proven experience supporting senior leadership as an Executive or Virtual Assistant.



Previous experience working with USA-based culture companies.



Proficient in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace tools.



Advanced Excel skills and financial/bookkeeping experience.



Exceptional organizational abilities and attention to detail.



Excellent written and verbal communication skills to interact professionally with both internal and external stakeholders.



Comfortable in a fast-paced, high-demand environment with real-time communication.



Proactive, resourceful, and able to anticipate needs before being asked.



Self-starter who can thrive with limited training and a hands-on, take-charge approach.



__________



What We Offer:



Stable, full-time role with growth potential in an established USA-based company.



Direct collaboration with executive leadership and opportunities to influence operations and strategy.



Comprehensive training on internal systems (limited training provided; proactive approach required).



Professional, supportive, and respectful team environment.



________________________________________________________________________________



If you are a proactive, self-starting professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can support an Executive with any tasks in real time, this role is for you.



Apply here:

title: Amazon PPC Specialist
description:

-Excellent English communication skills



Nice to Have

-Basic understanding of listing SEO and conversion optimisation

-Full-time remote role with long-term growth opportunity
