Track tasks, deadlines, and follow-ups across multiple projects/locations

Maintain accurate records in Google Drive (Docs/Sheets), including logs, checklists, and weekly status updates

Coordinate schedules, confirmations, and reminders (staff, families, partners)

Support program operations: registrations, basic troubleshooting, and routing issues to the right person

Create simple SOPs/checklists so work is repeatable and nothing gets missed

Flag issues early and propose solutions (not just report problems)



What we’re looking for

1+ year experience in admin, operations, or coordinator work (education/nonprofit a plus)

Strong writing skills: you can sound calm, helpful, and natural (not robotic)

Excellent follow-through and attention to detail

Comfortable juggling multiple priorities and switching contexts quickly

Confident with Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Drive)

Uses AI tools responsibly (optional): drafts are fine, but you verify details and keep a human voice



Nice to have

Experience supporting families/customers 
 + phone)

Familiarity with task boards/CRMs (Trello/Asana/Notion or similar)



To apply

Send your resume to 
 and answer these 3 questions:

1. How do you track tasks so nothing gets dropped?

2. When you’re learning a new process, how do you document it so you don’t need to be re-taught?

3. Give me an example of a time you improved a process and saved time each week. What changed and what was the impact?

rchandise industry

title: Shopify Website Manager – Conversion & AOV Focus
description:
We operate and scale multiple fashion ecommerce dropshipping brands on Shopify, promoted organically on TikTok.



Our stores are growing steadily, and as traffic increases, even small improvements in conversion rate and AOV make a meaningful impact on revenue.



We are now looking for a Shopify Website Manager focused on improving on-site performance, increasing AOV, and continuously refining the shopping experience.



This is a hands-on, execution-focused role with long-term potential.



ABOUT THE ROLE



You will be responsible for improving and maintaining our Shopify stores from a conversion and performance perspective.



This is not a pure graphic design role and not a high-level marketing strategy position.

We are looking for someone who enjoys working directly inside Shopify, improving layouts, refining product pages, and testing ideas that increase sales.



You will work closely with our
 marketer to ensure promotions and offers are properly reflected on-site and that campaigns and website structure are aligned.



Your responsibilities include:



-Reviewing Shopify stores and identifying areas for improvement

-Improving and refining theme layout and structure

Optimizing:

-Homepage

-Collection pages

-Product pages

-Cart and checkout



-Implementing upsells, bundles, and cross-sells

-Testing layout improvements, offer placements, and trust elements

-Improving clarity, trust, user flow, and shopping experience

-Executing website changes and ideas provided by the founder

-Measuring and reporting the impact of implemented changes



We are looking for someone practical, detail-oriented, and comfortable improving things step by step.



REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT)



You should have:



-Solid hands-on experience working with Shopify

-Experience modifying and improving Shopify themes (free or paid)

-Experience improving product pages and checkout flow

-Familiarity with upsell / bundle / cross-sell apps

-Understanding of how layout and structure impact conversion

-Basic HTML / CSS knowledge (JavaScript is a plus but not required)

-Ability to test ideas and evaluate results logically

-Strong communication and organization skills



This role is for someone who enjoys improving websites through practical execution — not someone focused only on design or high-level strategy.



WHAT WE OFFER



-Hourly rate: 9-9,5 USD/hour (based on experience)

-Part-time role (approximately 15–20 hours per week)

-Flexible working hours

-Long-term collaboration for the right candidate

-Opportunity to grow with multiple expanding fashion brands



We value reliability, ownership, and long-term partnerships.



HOW TO APPLY (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY)



To apply, please:



1) Change your application subject to:

“I want to improve your Shopify store O”

2) Short Written Introduction (4–6 sentences)

Briefly explain:



-Your relevant experience

-Why this role fits you

-Why you’re looking for a long-term position



3) Send your CV

4) Send a Loom video (3–5 minutes)

In your Loom, please explain:



-Your experience working inside Shopify stores

-How you d
 what to improve first on a Shopify store

-Which apps or tools you commonly use to improve product pages or cart performance



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Customer Support Virtual Assistant (Home Services Industry)
description:
Location: Remote (Must be available to work 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM Mountain Time, Monday-Friday, with possibility of a Saturday or Sunday)

Position: Full-Time Virtual Assistant (Customer Support)



About the Role:

We are seeking dedicated and experienced Virtual Assistants to join our customer support team. You will be the vital link between our customers and our field technicians, ensuring exceptional service delivery and customer satisfaction. This role is perfect for someone with a background in plumbing, HVAC, or related trades who excels in a fast-paced, communicative environment.



Schedule:

Primary: Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM Mountain Time.

Occasional Saturday or Sunday shifts may be required based on business needs.



Key Responsibilities:

Professionally handle inbound customer calls for service requests, scheduling, and estimates.

Make outbound follow-up calls (no cold calling) to customers and field technicians.

Manage and respond promptly to customer
s and live chat inquiries.

Accurately document and process customer cancellations and account corrections.

Resolve customer issues with empathy and efficiency.

Follow up on open service work orders to ensure completion and customer satisfaction.

Offer preliminary troubleshooting and telephone solution support.

Precisely enter and update service order information in the company’s dispatching/CRM system.

Collaborate closely with a team of approximately 20 field technicians and other support staff.



Required Qualifications:

Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in a customer support, dispatch, or administrative role within the home services industry (plumbing, heating, HVAC, electrical, etc.).

Proven experience working directly with US-based clients.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English with a light, neutral accent for clear phone communication.

Strong comfort level working within a team environment and coordinating with a large field technician team.

Tech-savvy with experience using computer-based dispatching, CRM, or work order systems.

Outstanding problem-solving skills and a customer-centric attitude.

Reliable home office setup with high-speed internet.



Preferred Qualifications:

Previous experience using ServiceTitan software is a significant advantage.

Additional experience in scheduling, dispatch, or call center environments.



To apply, please fill out this form. Thank you.

title: Lead UI/UX Designer – EduTrack
description:
About EduTrack

EduTrack is a growing EdTech platform focused on building smart, intuitive systems for schools and therapy-based organizations. Our mission is to create powerful tools that actually make life easier for administrators, educators, and clinicians.

We are looking for a Lead UI/UX Designer to take full ownership of the user experience and interface design across the platform.



Role Overview

As the Lead UI/UX Designer, you will own the entire UI/UX function of EduTrack. You will be responsible for translating real user needs into intuitive, clean, and scalable product designs. This is a key leadership role with real influence on product direction.

You will work closely with product, development, and leadership to shape how EduTrack looks, feels, and works.



Key Responsibilities

* Own and lead all UI/UX design for the EduTrack platform

* Deeply understand and analyze end-user needs (administrators, educators, therapists, parents, etc.)

* Translate complex workflows into simple, intuitive user experiences

* Design wireframes, user flows, prototypes, and high-fidelity UI designs

* Maintain and evolve the design system and product consistency

* Collaborate with developers to ensure accurate implementation

* Continuously improve UX based on feedback and real usage



Requirements

* Minimum 2+ years experience as a Lead / Senior UI/UX Designer

* Proven experience owning UI/UX projects end-to-end

* Very strong proficiency in Figma (must be expert level)

* Strong understanding of UX research, user journeys, and usability principles

* Experience working on complex systems (SaaS / dashboards / admin systems is a big plus)

* Ability to think both strategically and practically

* Strong communication and leadership skills



Nice to Have (Bonus)

* Experience in EdTech, HealthTech, or workflow-heavy systems

* Experience building design systems from scratch

* Understanding of accessibility and usability standards



What Makes This Role Special

* You are not “just a designer” — you own the product experience

* Real influence on a growing platform used by real organizations

* Opportunity to build something from the ground up

* Work directly with leadership and product vision



How to Apply

* Subject Line: Application for UI/UX Designer

* Attach your resume and links to project examples (must include SaaS and/or admin UI examples)

* Include your
 and onlinejobs.ph profile

* Mention your desired hourly salary range

* Send applications to:

title: Senior Ads Manager
description:
Role Overview



We are hiring a Senior Performance Ads Manager who takes full ownership of ad accounts — not just execution.



This is not a “set up campaigns and send reports” role.



You will be responsible for performance, stability, and recovery across multiple client accounts.



You should be comfortable operating in high-pressure environments, where accounts scale fast, get flagged, or require rapid restructuring.



What You Will Own



End-to-end management of Meta 
/Instagram) and Google Ads accounts

Budget ownership ranging from $10,000 to $100,000+ per month

Campaign planning, launch, testing, scaling, and controlled shutdowns

Diagnosing performance drops and fixing them without hand-holding

Working closely with creative, tracking, and operations teams

Handling policy issues, disapprovals, and account restrictions

Clear weekly performance reporting focused on decisions, not dashboards

Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)



You must have:



3+ years of hands-on ad buying experience (Meta required, Google preferred)

Personally managed at least $10,000/month in ad spend

Strong understanding of:

Conversion tracking (pixels, CAPI, GA4, GTM)

Attribution trade-offs and data reliability

Experience working with multiple clients simultaneously

Clear written English (you will be client-facing)

If you have only worked on:



boosted posts

single internal brands

learning projects

Do not apply.



Strong Advantage (Read Carefully)



You will be prioritized if you have experience with:



Restricted or sensitive verticals (e.g. gambling, crypto, health, IPTV, finance)

Account bans, BM restrictions, or repeated disapprovals

Pre-emptive compliance structuring and risk isolation

Ad account warm-ups and scaling under constraints

You do not need to be a “blackhat”, but you must understand how platforms actually behave in the real world.



How We Measure You



CPA / ROAS stability over time

Ability to diagnose problems before they become disasters

Quality of decisions under pressure

Clarity in communication with internal teams and management

Application Question (Mandatory)



Answer this clearly and honestly:



“Describe the worst ad account failure or ban you have handled.What happened, and what exactly did you do in the first 72 hours?”



Vague or generic answers will be rejected automatically.



What This Role Is NOT



Not a junior execution role

Not a learning position

Not a reporting-only job

Not suitable if you need step-by-step instructions

Summary



If you are an ads manager who:



owns outcomes,

understands risk,

and can think under pressure,

this role will suit you.



If you are looking to “learn ads” or follow SOPs, this role will not be a fit.



Job Type: Full-time



Benefits:





Flexible schedule

Work from home

Experience:





 Advertising: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Duda Website Designer
description:
???? About Us



Kickstart Local is a U.S.-based digital marketing agency that helps local businesses grow through professional website design, SEO, paid ads, and digital marketing systems.



We specialize in building clean, conversion-focused websites on the Duda platform. We are looking for a detail-oriented Duda Website Developer to join our growing team.



If you love building beautiful, responsive websites and take pride in clean layouts and structured design — this role is for you.



???? Responsibilities



Build responsive websites using the Duda platform



Customize templates and create custom sections



Ensure mobile responsiveness across all devices



Implement on-page SEO best practices (meta titles, headers, internal linking)



Connect domains, forms, tracking pixels, and basic integrations



Optimize page speed and performance



Make revisions based on client feedback



Follow brand guidelines and design direction



Work closely with our creative and marketing team



? Requirements



Proven experience building websites in Duda (Required)



Strong understanding of responsive design principles



Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS (for minor customizations)



Experience with:



Google Analytics



Google Tag Manager (basic setup)



Meta Pixel installation



Understanding of SEO structure (H1, H2, metadata, internal linking)



High attention to detail



Strong English communication skills



Reliable internet connection



? Bonus Skills (Not Required, But a Plus)



Experience building high-converting landing pages



Familiarity with conversion optimization



Graphic design experience (Canva or Adobe)



Experience with CRM integrations (GoHighLevel, HubSpot, etc.)



? Work Schedule



Flexible hours, but must overlap at least 2–3 hours with U.S. Eastern Time



Estimated 20–40 hours per week depending on workload



???? Growth Opportunity



We are looking for someone long-term. As our agency grows, this role can grow into:



Lead Web Developer



Website Project Manager



Team Lead



???? How to Apply



Please include:



Links to 3–5 Duda websites you personally built



Your expected monthly salary



A short description of your Duda experience



The word “Kickstart” at the top of your application so we know you read this entire post



???? Final Notes



We care about:



Clean design



Speed



Mobile performance



Conversion-focused layouts



Professional communication



If you’re someone who takes pride in quality work and wants to grow with a U.S.-based agency, we’d love to meet you.

title: Full Stack Game Developer (C# / Unity / PlayFab)
description:
We’re looking for a Full Stack Game Developer to help power a next generation of mobile fitness games — experiences that blend cozy monster collecting, real-world movement, and joyful daily activity.



As part of a small, mission-driven team, you’ll play a hands-on role in building and scaling the systems behind our upcoming soft launch. This role is ideal for engineers who thrive at the intersection of gaming, backend systems, and live operations — crafting performant, stable, and delightful experiences that connect players’ real-world motion to in-game progress.



Perks & Benefits

- Paid in USD (bi-monthly payouts: 15th & 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays (based on your location)

- 100% remote – work from anywhere

- Build your portfolio with brand campaigns that blend storytelling and tech

- Collaborate with creative producers, strategists, and social media managers



What You’ll Be Doing

- Build and maintain game backend systems for a live-operated mobile game using Azure, PlayFab, Unity, and C#

- Develop and deploy backend services using container technologies (Docker) and orchestration tools like Kubernetes

- Design, document, and communicate technical specifications for new features

- Integrate game client and backend systems to support multiplayer, progression, and live event features

- Develop responsive web game dashboards and companion sites using React or React Native, JavaScript, and HTML

- Support smooth live operations by debugging issues, optimizing server performance, and improving workflows

- Collaborate with engineering, art, design, and narrative teams to bring the game vision to life

- Conduct code reviews, share best practices, and mentor other engineers as needed



Who You Are

- 3+ years of professional experience in software or game development

- Proven track record of shipping a commercial Unity game or major feature (mobile preferred)

- Experience with backend development and integrating live services (e.g., PlayFab, REST APIs, or cloud functions)

- Comfortable owning end-to-end features — from architecture and implementation to deployment

- Strong communicator who thrives in fast-paced, collaborative, remote teams

- Familiar with GitLab CI/CD pipelines and modern DevOps practices



Bonus Points

- Familiarity with web technologies (React, REST APIs, dashboards)

- Experience with Azure Cloud and PlayFab services

- Knowledge of Unity Addressables, UaaL, or mobile sensor APIs (step count, geolocation)

- Prior experience working on live-service games or fitness/wellness apps

- Interest in AI, ML, or UGC systems within gaming

- Enthusiasm for fitness, creativity, and movement-based play



How to Apply

Please submit:

1. Your updated resume

2. A 1–2 minute Loom video introducing yourself and your design background

*Only candidates who submit a Loom video and portfolio will be moved to the next step of the hiring process.*

title: Multimedia Designer (Graphic + Motion/Video, Paid Ads Focus)
description:
We’re looking for a Multimedia Designer who thrives at the intersection of storytelling, design, and culture. This role requires someone who can craft scroll-stopping visuals—both static and short-form motion—that power high-performing ads and social campaigns for a luxury lifestyle brand rooted in scent, sensation, and unrestrained creativity.



If you’re a designer with an editorial eye and the versatility to move between ads, social, and brand design, this role is for you. You’ll be working on content that ranges from striking static ads to short-form videos and motion loops—always with the goal of making people pause mid-scroll.



Perks & Benefits

- Paid in USD (bi-monthly payouts: 15th & 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays (based on your location)

- 100% remote – work from anywhere

- Build the visual identity for a rising niche luxury brand

- Opportunity to lead and evolve the brand’s creative direction



What You’ll Be Doing

Design & Creative Execution

- Produce ads, social content, and campaign visuals that grab attention and drive engagement

- Create moodboards, concepts, and templates aligned with the brand’s aesthetic

- Design across formats: static graphics, branded layouts, packaging assets, and ad variations

- Apply a trend-aware, culture-first lens to ensure creative feels fresh yet elevated



Motion & Video Editing

- Edit and animate short-form ads, reels, and stories for Instagram, TikTok, and paid media

- Repurpose existing content into new ad formats and variations

- Experiment with AI-generated visuals and new media tools to push creative boundaries

- Build repeatable templates and systems to scale content output efficiently



Who You Are

- 3–5+ years in graphic design, multimedia, or motion design

- Experience designing for ads, social, or content-driven brands (fashion, lifestyle, media a plus)

- Portfolio that shows both strong design and motion/video work

- Skilled in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects), plus Figma or Canva



Bonus: Experience with AI creative tools (Runway ML, Midjourney, Kaiber, etc.)

- Strong conceptual thinker with an editorial/fashion sensibility

- Self-driven, collaborative, and excited to push creative boundaries in digital ads



If you’re a creative rebel who designs with edge, clarity, and ambition—and you're ready to lead visuals for a fragrance brand that doesn’t play it safe—we want to meet you.



How to Apply

Please submit:

1. Your updated resume

2. A portfolio showcasing your best static and motion work (social, ads, or brand campaigns)

3. A brief 1-2 minute Loom video sharing your graphic design experience and industries you've worked in

Only candidates who submit a Loom video and portfolio will be moved to the next step of the hiring process.



If you’re a creative rebel who designs with edge, clarity, and ambition—and you're ready to lead visuals for a fragrance brand that doesn’t play it safe—we want to meet you.

title: Product Data & Labeling Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a Product Data and Labeling Specialist who can own the accuracy, structure, and flow of product data and labeling across a growing food distribution operation. This role sits at the intersection of operations, compliance, and supply chain, ensuring that product information, barcodes, and packaging specs are correct, consistent, and ready for market.



You will manage labeling programs, barcoding standards, and specification documentation while coordinating closely with suppliers, internal teams, and creative partners. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-driven, systems-oriented, and comfortable owning complex product data in regulated environments.



If you enjoy bringing order to product information, maintaining compliance, and acting as the source of truth for labeling and coding, this role is a strong fit.



Why You’ll Want to Join



- You will be paid in USD (bi-monthly: every 15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays per company guidelines

- 100 percent remote setup so you can work wherever you’re most productive

- High-ownership role supporting long-standing product programs and new launches

- Opportunity to work cross-functionally across operations, supply chain, and creative teams



 What You’ll Work On



Product Data and Barcoding Management



- Own and maintain product barcoding including UPC, EAN, and GS1 standards

- Manage product data through GDSN with familiarity or hands-on experience using GDSN-128

- Ensure product identifiers are accurate, current, and aligned across internal and customer systems

- Support new item setup, product changes, and line extensions



Labeling and Packaging Control



- Review, approve, and control all product labels and carton markings prior to production

- Ensure accuracy, consistency, and compliance with internal standards and customer requirements

- Maintain version control for labels, cartons, and packaging assets

- Coordinate packaging updates with suppliers and internal stakeholders



Specification Documentation



- Create, update, and maintain detailed product specification sheets

- Ensure specs reflect current formulations, packaging, coding, and regulatory requirements

- Act as the source of truth for product specifications across teams and partners



Cross-Functional Coordination



- Work closely with suppliers to collect and validate product data and artwork

- Partner with internal operations, quality, and supply chain teams to maintain data integrity

- Collaborate with a graphic designer or creative partner on private label packaging updates

- Respond to customer inquiries, audits, and internal reviews related to labeling and data



Process and Quality Support



- Maintain organized documentation for all product data and labeling materials

- Support audits and compliance checks related to product information

- Identify gaps or inconsistencies and proactively recommend improvements





What You Bring



- 3 to 6+ years of experience in product data management, labeling, or packaging roles

- Strong working knowledge of GS1 standards with experience using GDSN

- Familiarity with or experience supporting GDSN-128 barcoding protocols

- Experience creating and managing product specification sheets

- High attention to detail and strong organizational skills

- Clear written and verbal communication with internal and external partners

- Comfort managing multiple products, updates, and deadlines simultaneously

- Proficiency with Microsoft Office and product data or specification systems



Nice to Have



- Experience in food, CPG, or import and distribution environments

- Familiarity with food labeling regulations and customer compliance requirements

- Experience supporting private label programs

- Background working with global suppliers or imported products





 How to Apply



Please Send me a message with the following:

1. Your updated resume

2. A short 1–2 minute Loom video introducing yourself and describing your experience with product data, labeling, or GS1 standards



Only candidates who submits a link of their resume and a Loom video will be considered.





If you thrive on accuracy, understand how product data flows from supplier to shelf, and want to own labeling and coding systems that keep operations running smoothly, this role gives you the opportunity to be the backbone of product integrity and compliance.

title: Web Developer ( Analytics and Tracking )
description:
We’re looking for a Web Developer who specializes in ecommerce builds, CMS platforms, and precise tracking implementation. This role focuses on the technical backbone of marketing performance, ensuring websites are fast, stable, and correctly instrumented for analytics, paid media, and conversion tracking.



This is not a visual design role. It is ideal for a developer who enjoys working with React-based frontends, Shopify and WordPress builds, and deeply understands how tracking, pixels, and ecommerce data flow power growth teams.



If you are comfortable moving between code, CMS platforms, and marketing infrastructure and take pride in clean implementations that just work, this role will fit you well.



Why You’ll Want to Join:

- You will be paid in USD (bi-monthly: every 15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually 

- Observance of Holidays per company guidelines

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you feel most productive

- Work closely with performance marketers, analysts, and engineers

- Ownership over the technical layer behind high-performing ecommerce campaigns



What You’ll Work On:

Ecommerce Web Development

- Build, maintain, and optimize ecommerce websites using React, Shopify, WordPress, and headless CMS setups

- Implement and customize themes, components, and frontend logic for performance and scalability

- Support checkout flows, product pages, and site speed optimizations



Tracking and Instrumentation

- Implement Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, Google Ads conversions, and related tracking tools

- Configure and validate ecommerce events such as add-to-cart, checkout, and purchase

- Troubleshoot attribution issues and ensure clean, reliable data across platforms



CMS and Platform Integrations

- Work across Shopify, WooCommerce, Webflow, and custom CMS environments

- Integrate third-party APIs for payments, shipping, analytics, and marketing tools

- Ensure tracking and integrations do not negatively impact site performance



Performance and Reliability

- Optimize page load speed, responsiveness, and frontend performance

- Debug frontend and backend issues related to tracking, ecommerce logic, or integrations

- Maintain clean codebases and well-documented implementations



What You Bring

- 5+ years of experience as a Web Developer, Ecommerce Developer, or Full Stack Developer

- Strong experience with React.js and modern JavaScript (ES6+)

- Hands-on experience with Shopify, WordPress, WooCommerce, or headless CMS builds

- Deep familiarity with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, and conversion tracking

- Comfortable working with APIs, webhooks, and ecommerce data flows

- Strong debugging skills and attention to technical detail

- Ability to collaborate with non-technical marketing and operations teams



Nice to Have

- Experience with headless CMS frameworks

- Familiarity with server-side tracking or advanced attribution setups

- Background supporting performance marketing or paid media teams

- Experience with AWS, CI/CD, or cloud deployments



How to Apply: 

Please submit

- Your updated resume

- A short intro video recorded in loom . com (1–2 mins) introducing yourself and describing your relevant experience

- Portfolio Link (Live Website Samples)



*Only candidates who submit a Loom video will be moved to the next step of the hiring process.

title: Video Brief Writer and Production Manager
description:
We’re looking for a Video Brief Writer and Production Manager who can support a fast-moving creative production company across scheduling, communication, backend operations, and project management. This role blends high-level executive support with hands-on production coordination, helping bring structure, clarity, and 
ntum to a busy environment.



You’ll manage calendars, communication, vendor relations, project timelines, and operational systems like Drive and Notion. You’ll work closely with leadership to keep production workflows running smoothly and ensure both internal teams and clients feel supported and informed.



If you thrive in creative environments, enjoy organizing complex moving parts, and understand how production teams operate, this role will feel like a natural fit.



Why You’ll Want to Join



- You will be paid in USD (bi-monthly: 15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually

- Observed holidays per company guidelines

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you feel most productive

- Work directly with leadership across a growing production company

- Opportunity to build systems and shape operations behind high-quality creative work





Executive Support

- Manage calendars, scheduling, inbox organization, and follow-ups

- Support general operational and administrative needs for leadership



Production and Project Management

- Lead projects end-to-end across timelines, deliverables, and resources

- Build and maintain clear SOPs for scalable content workflows

- Oversee content production and platform optimization

- Monitor performance and drive engagement-focused improvements

- Stay ahead of platform trends and cultural shifts to inform strategy



Vendor and Client Coordination

- Communicate with vendors, freelancers, and partners to keep production on track

- Manage quotes, scheduling, deliverables, and follow-ups across projects

- Support client coordination by preparing updates, summaries, and next steps

- Track invoices, payments, and vendor-related documentation



Operational Systems and Organization

- Support leadership in managing campaigns, creative partnerships, and storytelling initiatives

- Maintain organized project folders, briefs, and documentation

- Improve internal workflows to increase clarity and reduce friction

- Identify process gaps and bring proactive solutions to streamline operations



What You Bring

- 3 to 5+ years of experience as Project Manager or Production Coordinator

- Background in agency content strategy, digital marketing, or creative operations, ideally supporting high-growth brands

- Strong project management skills with experience building SOPs and workflows (Notion, ClickUp, etc.)

- Proven ability to manage complex creative pipelines and timelines

- Experience fostering strong relationships with internal teams and clients

- Data-driven approach with the ability to translate insights into execution

- Strong creative judgment and innovative storytelling mindset



Nice to Have

- Familiarity with production workflows, call sheets, timelines, and deliverables

- Background in creative agencies or content studios

- Experience building systems or improving operational processes





How to Apply



Please include:



1. Your updated resume highlighting EA and production-related experience

2. A short 1–2 minute Loom video introducing yourself and describing how you’ve supported production or creative workflows



Only candidates who submit a Loom video will move forward.





If you’re someone who brings structure to creative environments and enjoys being the operational engine behind high-quality production, this role gives you the chance to make a meaningful impact every day.

title: FB Ads Media Buyer - Managing $60K+ Monthly
description:
Are you detail-oriented, reliable, and looking for a stable full-time position without micromanagement where you can master your craft and be part of a team that actually values consistency and precision?



If that's you, keep reading.



My name’s Julien, founder of Home Run Marketing. We’re a tight-knit, fast-moving team of high-performers scaling quickly in the painting industry.

We help painting companies become the go-to choice in their market through:

- Owner-generated ads on
 and Instagram

- Lead handling and appointment scheduling

- Sales coaching and business guidance to ensure they win

In the first 3 months, our average client generates an 11.2x ROAS (50?ove market average), and I need YOU to help us continue delivering these amazing results!



**Your Role**

Your role is to support a marketing strategist by executing their strategies with accuracy and attention to detail so campaigns run smoothly, data stays clean, and clients get consistent results.

If you love structured tasks, clear expectations, and being the person everyone can count on, you’ll love this job.

Your main day-to-day tasks will be:

- Launch and manage Meta campaigns.

- Set up new clients inside our systems (GoHighLevel, Google Sheets, ClickUp)

- Handle the creative process from requesting client content to collaborating with the creative editor to turn the content into converting creatives.

- Analyze all sorts of data (lead quality, geographic data, engagement, cost per appointment, cost per sale, ROAS) and generate reports.

- Documenting test results and other client information.



**Requirements (Deal Breakers)**

- Flawless spoken & written English. (Improper written English is a deal breaker)

- Great process adherence. Can reliably follow SOPs and procedures without mistakes.

- Excellent communicator & team player.

- Extremely fast learner.

- Strong time management & prioritization.

- 1y+ experience of
 ads (Knows how to set up campaigns, launch ads, run split tests, spot ad fatigue, spot performance issues, etc.)



**Details**

- Salary: Starting $1,100 USD/month (potential to earn up to $1,500 USD/month within 1 year)

- Schedule: 40 hours, Monday to Friday, 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern time

- Unlimited paid time off: Take vacations anytime, as long as your work is covered.



**APPLY HERE**



If this sounds like it’s for you, apply now with the link above!

I’ll personally review your application within 24 hours and reach out if you’re a fit.

See you on the inside!

title: Executive Assistant to Founder | Strategy & Operations
description:
About The Role



You will work directly with a founder managing multiple ventures across consulting, F&B, brand development, and growth projects. This is not a basic admin role it is a high-trust position focused on organization, execution, and operational support.



We are looking for someone extremely organized, detail-oriented, proactive, and calm under pressure.



If you enjoy bringing structure to fast-moving environments, you will thrive in this role.



Your Core Responsibilities



Executive Support

• Manage calendars and schedule meetings efficiently

• Prepare meeting agendas and document key action items

• Track tasks and ensure follow-ups are completed

• Organize
 communications when required



Operations & Documentation

• Maintain Google Sheets, trackers, and internal dashboards

• Organize company documents and workflows

• Build and maintain a structured Notion workspace

• Format professional reports and presentations



Project Coordination

Founder Positioning Support

Ideal Candidate

Experience as an Executive Assistant, Operations Coordinator, or Project Assistant is strongly preferred.



This role requires someone who takes ownership and prides themselves on accuracy. Small details matter here.



Growth opportunities and increased compensation will be available for high performers.



Applications missing this line will not be reviewed.

title: Recruiter
description:
VortexWorks provides premier customer-experience and support solutions for nationally recognized brands. We bridge the gap between motivated professionals and flexible, remote opportunities. At VortexWorks, we value performance, professionalism, and the power of clear communication. We are looking for a Recruiter who can identify top-tier talent and ensure they have the tools and drive to succeed in a remote environment.



The Role

As our Recruiter, you are the gatekeeper of the VortexWorks hiring standard. You will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and onboarding remote professionals who will represent major brands. This isn’t just about culture fit - it’s about ensuring every candidate has the technical infrastructure and the work ethic to thrive from home.



Key Responsibilities:



High-Volume Sourcing: Manage a robust pipeline of candidates for customer service and sales roles.



Technical Vetting: Verify that candidates meet our strict hardware requirements (dual monitors, hard-wired internet, noise-canceling headsets).



Screening & Interviewing: Conduct high-energy interviews to assess English proficiency, empathy, and professionalism.



Onboarding Coordination: Guide candidates through the initial training modules and ensure a seamless transition to the production floor.



Brand Representation: Act as the first point of contact, selling the benefits of the VortexWorks flexible remote model.



Who You Are

The Technical Gatekeeper: You understand that a "USB headset" and "hard-wired internet" are non-negotiables, and you aren't afraid to be firm on those standards.



High-Volume Expert: You are comfortable managing a large number of applicants without letting the "human touch" slide.



Excellent Communicator: You have a "radio-ready" professional voice and can spot great communication skills in others.



Detail-Oriented: You can track hundreds of applicants through the funnel without losing sight of the paperwork.



Requirements:



2+ years of experience in high-volume recruiting (Call center, BPO, or Staffing experience is a massive plus).



Deep familiarity with ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems) and LinkedIn Recruiter.



Strong understanding of remote work dynamics and home-office technical requirements.



Bilingual (Spanish/English) is a plus, as many of our roles offer additional pay for bilingual talent.

title: Account Manager
description:
Benefits:

Work From Home

Guaranteed $500 USD per week

Additional available if you perform well

Unlimited potential through residual because you earn as long as your customers say with Fleetsmarts





What we do as a company:

We give a fuel card away for free to truckers in the US that have discounts on diesel fuel. We have add-on products that make the sale more attractive to the customer. Customers can get weekly credit lines for their fuel card if they use our factoring service, which is akin to a pay-day loan service for businesses, but we provide this service for free. We also have a service to help reduce the down payment on their insurance. We market to new trucking companies that are just starting out and all our products are designed to help them get going faster than they would be able to on their own.





What you do:

You call warm appointments for truckers who have already expressed interest

You explain how we can help them

95% of people say yes

The key is following up until they actually start using our services





We set up 4 interviews per day in between the hours of 4:00 and 6:00pm

We will choose one new Cat 3 Re-Engager per week.

After one week, if they don’t hit 60% patch rate, they are out.

For 5 weeks, if they hit high patch rate, we rotate them between Hannah and Cat 1s

We promote one each week to Cat 3 leads and replace our worst AM.





Key Responsibilities:

Proactively follow up on abandoned or inactive leads assigned to account managers.

Present and promote fuel card programs, factoring services, and insurance solutions to potential clients.

Assist customers with the activation of fuel cards and ensure a preferred payment method is added.

Offer factoring services and guide customers through the contract signing process to ensure completion and compliance



Qualifications:

Proven experience in sales, customer retention, or outbound calling (required)

Strong communication and negotiation skills

Confident handling high-volume outbound calls

Goal-oriented, persistent, and able to work independently

Organized and comfortable using CRM tools and office software

Positive attitude and ability to build rapport quickly

title: Account Manager
description:

Work From Home

Guaranteed $500 USD per week

Additional available if you perform well

Unlimited potential through residual because you earn as long as your customers say with Fleetsmarts

title: Social Media Manager / Content Creator - A true once in a lifetime opportunity with profit sharing.
description:
If you want to look for a career that could change your life and those around you, please take the time to read this...





Digital Marketing Specialist for the companies - Advance Building Supplies / 



We have a once in a lifetime opportunity for an experienced digital marketing professional.  This opportunity is with an already established and successful company looking for a high rate of growth in 2026.



About Us

We operate multiple businesses serving the exterior construction industry across Canada.  We sell both wholesale and retail products to customers across Canada and have also launched a new software (SAAS) offering which will be available throughout all of North America.



We run a small lean company where those who work hard and excel can achieve incredible success, but there is no room for someone not pulling their weight.



We want to add a rockstar marketing manager to our mix to increase our lead traffic and support our growth

________________________________________



The Role

You will be responsible for the overall marketing initiatives of the company and ultimately  generating qualified leads.  Our primary market is small and niche so we are looking for an individual who is capable of targeting smaller and more defined audiences through

•
 Ads – build and monitor our
 and Instagram campaigns

• Google Ads – Build and monitor our Google ad campaigns 

• Retargeting campaigns

• Landing page optimization

• Basic funnel builds

• Supporting content creation

• Creating photo and video content and supporting the sales and training teams



Basic video and photo editing skills to be able to create content in house.

• Ad creative production

• Post creation

• Image preparation

• Short-form content repurposing



We prefer someone who can execute creatively rather than outsource everything.



Who we are looking for

- Someone with considerable experience with existing advertising platforms – these platforms can be confusing and are always changing.  We are not looking for someone who doesn’t have the experience dealing with them already

- The ideal candidate will treat this business as if it is their own,  the customers as if they are their own customers and as a result will also be rewarded accordingly as well.

- A team player.  We are a small and focused group that is always looking to help out all of our existing teammates to successfully get our jobs done.  The success we feel as a company is shared among all of us so it is important we are all working together.

- A self starter.  There is always something to be done in business.  There should never be idle time while waiting for tasks.  There is always pre planning, creating future content and many other things that can be done.  We want someone who cares about timelines and looks forward to being pro active vs reactive



What We Are NOT Looking For

• Someone who needs constant supervision or needs to “learn the different marketing campaigns or platforms

• Someone who blames algorithms or other factors for poor results

• Someone who “launches and forgets”

• Someone who works 20 minutes a day and disappears thinking that is good enough.



We need proactive execution.



The successful candidate must have:

• Strong understanding of
 Ads Manager

• Strong understanding of Google Ads

• Ability to target small niche audiences precisely

• Analytical mindset

• Ability to create and test multiple variations

• Ownership mentality

• Comfortable being accountable to numbers



Most importantly - Compensation

So why do we say this is a once in a lifetime opportunity.  

Our company is already successful and you would be part of our profit sharing program which includes the success we already have.



We are looking at continual 20 – 50% growth year over year which gives you the opportunity to see your compensation rise in the future as we continue to grow.



While above average compensation is part of it, we feel our culture is just as important.  We work as a small family team where everyone has an important role to play.  We often collaborate as a team and work together towards a common end goal.



This is a position that we feel will be “life changing” for the successful individual.  The compensation schedule is extremely generous and hard work and results are rewarded with virtually no cap on earning potential.   Also as we feel that this job has to be the right fit for you we would give you the opportunity to speak to our current team if you wish so you can get a feel of what this company is all about.



We are approaching our busiest time of year.  There should be no lag in being able to see the benefits of your hard work.  

This is a full time position however we do not micromanage time. We measure results.



Hiring Process



We don’t want to waste your time.  Anyone who doesn’t answer the following questions will not be contacted.  Likewise, if you use AI to answer the following questions you will not be contacted.  We are looking for someone who demonstrates they are willing to put in effort in this position and this questionnaire is a perfect example of that.  



However if you do put in the effort and have the right experience you have an excellent chance and earning a position that could change your life and the people around you.  



1) Please describe your past experience as a Marketing manager and who your worked for?  

2) Please list the platforms you work with as well as your proficiency level with each?

3) What tools do you use for photo and video editing?

4) We have a very small and niche market that we sell the majority of our products to.  Describe how you would create a target audience in
 so that our advertising budget is going directly to potential customers?  Walk us through house you would build a targeted
 campaign designed to target Canadian Roofing and Exterior Renovation Contractors

5) Describe how you would create a Google adwords campain so that our advertising budget is going directly to potential customers?  Walk us through house you would build a targeted Google campaign designed to target Canadian Roofing and Exterior Renovation Contractors.

6) What is your ability to learn a product?  We want someone who is able to learn the in and out details of the products we sell so you can understand them and as a result effectively market them.  The products we sell are the Zip Hinge (
) , KWM Gutter machines (
), and JobExact software (
).   How would you learn about these products in order to understand how to best market them?

7) Please list your past experience in a role or position such as this.  What was your position?  Were you in charge of any other people or who did you report to?

8) Please describe your comfort level in creating digital marketing materials such as short videos and training materials

9) This role and it’s compensation are performance driven.  How would you structure your day to ensure you are able to stay focused and committed and generating the required results.  What would you do if you were able to generate our minimum KPI’s in 2 – 3 hours of your scheduled day?

10) Our target market is North America.  What would be your ability to conduct part of your working day during North American business hours.

11) Describe a successful marketing strategy or campaign you designed in the past that was “outside the box” or unique and why it was effective.

12) What is your expected rate of pay and hours of work per week 

13) Why do you feel you are the best candidate for this job and any other information that you think would be relevant in our selecting you for this position.



We really look forward to hearing from you.  As we are looking to fill this position immediately, we will be responding to your replies and scheduling interviews quickly.  We are excited to introduce a new member to our team and look forward to growing our company together with you!

title: Systems & Operations Specialist
description:
Are you looking to make a career change? Are you passionate about working with nonprofits? Maybe you have taken some time off and now you want to pivot your skills into a more tech-savvy field but aren’t sure how. Nonprofit Megaphone is a remote, home-based company with a paid hands-on training program to amplify nonprofit voices! 



Nonprofit Megaphone empowers organizations to expand their reach and impact by assisting them in obtaining and effectively managing the Google Ad Grant. Through this grant, nonprofits are able to share their stories with a wider global audience. Our team was recently recognized by Inc. Magazine on the Inc. 500 List as one of the fastest-growing companies in America. 



At Nonprofit Megaphone, our team is 100% remote, so we are one of the few companies where working from home is the rule, not the exception. Because we are remote, we take team culture very seriously. Nonprofit Megaphone also understands the need for portable and flexible careers and proudly supports military spouse employment through the Hiring Our Heroes #DiscoverTheTalent initiative.



Position Specifics: Contract position, full-time, hourly position, 9:00-5:00 M-F within EST, CST, MST, or PST time zones.



Perks:



Robust On The Job Training: With Nonprofit Megaphone’s hands-on training you will learn new career skills, in-demand tech knowledge, and gain the confidence needed to transition and thrive in your new career. There is no need for direct experience!

Earn While You Learn: During your first 90 days you’ll be paid while you learn each new skill and technology.



Remote First Culture: We thrive in our remote environment and want you to as well. We spend time getting to know one another and building relationships both virtually and in person.



Growth: Nonprofit Megaphone recognizes great assets when we see them. Our employees have the ability to continue their learning and growth through ongoing training and development.



Workplace Cohesion: We are a no drama llama environment and strive to build and support an atmosphere that is centered around inclusivity, honesty, drive, and transparency. As part of our commitment to fostering transparency and collaboration, we also offer open office hours once a week with our leadership team, which anyone is welcome to join. 

 

Compensation & Benefits:

- $5 USD per hour.

- 11 Federally Paid Holidays.

- An optional soft close week which falls between Christmas Eve and New Year’s Day to give our employees time to rest, relax, and recharge before the new year.

- A $175 USD instant starting balance in your Tech and Wellness Stipend account upon successful completion of your 90-day review. You will then start receiving a $7 USD monthly recurring injection on your 1-year anniversary.



Job Summary:

As an Enterprise Service Specialist, you’ll support the operational side of our Enterprise Services team — ensuring smooth, profitable, and high-quality delivery of services like Visito
, SEO, and future Enterprise Services. 



You’ll be responsible for onboarding, technical setup, workflow management, and back-end problem solving that allows our team to serve nonprofit clients efficiently and effectively. 



You’ll collaborate closely with the Head of Enterprise Services, Advisors, and other tea
mbers to maintain seamless operations, troubleshoot issues, and continually improve service profitability and client satisfaction.



Key Responsibilities & Duties:

- Support onboarding and back-end operations for Enterprise Services (Visito
, SEO, and other future services).

- Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve service-related issues promptly (or delegate as needed).

- Document and optimize workflows for quality, efficiency, and repeatability.

- Collaborate with Enterprise Service Advisors and internal teams to ensure exceptional client experiences.

- Set up client accounts for Enterprise Services and oversee or troubleshoot additional setups.

- Support automation tools such as Zapier and Make, ensuring reliable backend performance.

- Communicate confidently with clients, vendors, and teammates about technical aspects of Enterprise Services.

- Complete assigned projects and tasks on time and with precision.

- Proactively share ideas with the Head of Enterprise Services to improve team profitability and performance.



Qualifications:

- Complete fluency in the English language, including spelling of words, rules of composition, and proper grammar.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

- Comfortable with technology, including competence with computers, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Hubspot, and the willingness to learn more tools and systems (Asana, Make, Zapier) 

- Ability to learn quickly and work independently in a remote setting.

- Excellent time management skills and a home environment that supports working remotely.

- Ability to receive constructive criticism and feedback on your work and a constant willingness to improve.

- Ability to analyze data and information and identify the underlying principles, reasons, and facts behind it.

- Maintain a good attitude and positivity with tea
mbers.

- Ability to stay organized, juggle multiple priorities as needed, and complete tasks quickly and accurately.

- Strong need for attention to detail and the ability to proofread your own work quickly and accurately.

- Actively contributing in tea
etings.

- Being flexible in your role as priorities or best practices change. 

- Always follow our core values: Growth Champion, Results, Always Honorable, No Drama (Llama), and Team Player.



Tech Requirements:

- Quiet, distraction-free environment for phone calls/meetings.

- Typing speed of 60+ words per minute.

- A computer with audio and visual capabilities for on-video Zoo
etings with strong internet connectivity.



Note to Applicants:



This job description is a general overview and will evolve as the company grows and adapts to new needs.



As part of our hiring process, all applicants must complete and pass our four assessments: Critical Thinking, Typing Test, Computer/Tech Skills, and Grammar. These assessments provide valuable insights and help us ensure a good match for both you and the role. We believe they make the process more objective, and if you don't perform well, the job might not be a great fit for you.



To apply for this role:



Please submit your application through this form: 



Important: All sections of the form must be completed for your application to be considered.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Position Summary: The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is responsible for identifying and creating new qualified opportunities for the VortexWorks sales team. This role focuses on the early stages of the sales funnel, utilizing outbound prospecting techniques to engage with decision-makers at nationally recognized brands.



Key Responsibilities:



Conduct outbound prospecting via cold calling,
 campaigns, and social selling (LinkedIn).



Qualify inbound leads and assess their suitability for VortexWorks CX and support solutions.



Schedule discovery calls and demonstrations for the Account Executive team.



Research target accounts to identify key stakeholders and understand their business pain points.



Consistently meet or exceed monthly KPIs for lead generation and qualified meetings.



Log all sales activity accurately in the CRM.



Requirements:



Professional Experience: 1+ years of experience in a sales or business development role.



Technical Setup: Must possess a 2-monitor setup, Windows 10/11, 8GB+ RAM, and a hard-wired Ethernet connection.



Communication: Ability to articulate complex service offerings clearly and persuasively.



Attributes: High resilience, coachability, and a competitive drive to exceed targets.



Industry Knowledge: Understanding of BPO or customer service outsourcing is preferred but not required.

title: Executive Assistant (Remote – Philippines)
description:
About the Role

We are looking for a highly capable, proactive, and solution-oriented Executive Assistant to support the CEO and C-level leadership team.



This is not a passive admin role. You will act as an execution partner who helps reduce mental load, keeps things moving, and handles both business and personal administrative tasks with ownership and discretion. The right person is organized, calm under pressure, and comfortable handling a mix of executive work, research, outreach, follow-ups, and small life-admin tasks that make a real difference.



Key Responsibilities

Inbox & Calendar Management: Actively manage the CEO’s
 inbox by reading, filtering, prioritizing, and organizing messages. Draft responses and resolve requests directly when possible.



Executive & C-Level Support: Provide operational support to the leadership team. Ensure action items are executed and never forgotten.



Research, Outreach & Follow-Up: Conduct research on vendors and partnership opportunities. Identify key contacts and manage professional outreach and follow-up.



Personal & Life Administration: Handle critical personal tasks (booking appointments, coordinating services, managing deliveries) to reduce the CEO's mental load.



Organization & Problem-Solving: Identify issues before they become problems and resolve them proactively.



Reporting: Provide concise updates on completed tasks, pending items, and decisions needed.



What We’re Looking For

Strong written and verbal English communication skills.



Excellent organization, follow-up, and prioritization abilities.



Comfortable handling sensitive information with discretion.

- Track KPIs such as Lead ? client conversion, Onboarding completion rate, Churn rate, Account expansions & Client satisfaction.

- Prepare weekly sales and retention reports with insights and next steps.



Required Skills & Expertise:

, LinkedIn, and calendar management communication.

title: SEO Specialist - Full Time (Seeking Experienced Professionals in PH or India)
description:
Role Summary:

We are hiring an experienced and highly analytical SEO Specialist (Individual Contributor) who will independently own end-to-end SEO across all three brands: Maker’s Row, 
, and TailoredTeams.



Application Process:

Subject Line: SEO Specialist_[Your Full Name]



Must Include:

A 1–2 minute video introduction and a short explanation of why you’re a great fit for this opportunity. (good spoken English preferred) 

A portfolio Link

Your resume with an active phone number (we will call during EST hours if shortlisted).



This role requires someone who can:

- Develop the strategy

- Execute all technical, on-page, and off-page tasks

- Create SEO-driven content briefs

- Work with engineering/design on implementations

- Track performance

- Build reports, dashboards, and insights

- The candidate must be comfortable being hands-on and execution-heavy, while also thinking long-term and strategically.



Core Purpose: 

To independently drive organic traffic, keyword growth, domain authority, and conversions through a comprehensive SEO strategy executed hands-on by the candidate.



Key Responsibilities:

- Independently plan, execute, and manage SEO roadmap for all three brands.

- Take responsibility for the entire SEO lifecycle; from keyword research to technical audits to backlinking to reporting.

- Build an SEO strategy aligned with each business.

- Set clear SEO KPIs, timelines, content clusters, and traffic goals.

- Identify new organic growth opportunities and present structured plans.

- Perform full-funnel keyword research across multiple ICPs.

- Create keyword clusters, topic maps, pillar-cluster frameworks.

- Execute all on-page SEO activities including metadata and header optimization, schema and alt attribute enhancements, internal linking, and full content optimization aligned with semantic search and E-E-A-T standards.

- Conduct comprehensive technical SEO audits and execute fixes across crawlability, indexation, site speed, Core Web Vitals, redirects, canonicalization, structured data, and overall site architecture by collaborating with engineering for implementation and validation.

- Create SEO-driven content briefs, optimize existing content for ranking and depth, and collaborate with the content team while independently owning the end-to-end SEO direction.

- Execute off-page SEO by running link-building campaigns, securing high-authority backlinks through guest posts and PR opportunities, monitoring DA/DR and link quality, and managing disavow submissions as needed.

- Build and maintain GA4, GSC, and Sheets dashboards while delivering weekly, monthly, and quarterly SEO reports covering all the key metrics along with insights and actionable next steps.



Required Skills & Tools:

Technical Expertise: On-page optimization, Technical SEO audits, Structured data / schema, SEO for SaaS or marketplace sites, Keyword clustering & topic mapping, Backlink strategy, Core Web Vitals improvements, Site architecture & crawl optimization, CMS proficiency (WordPress/Webflow/custom).

Tools: Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog / Sitebulb, Google Search Console, GA4, Google Tag Manager, SurferSEO (nice to have), Looker Studio.



Experience Requirements:

- Minimum 5 years of hands-on SEO execution.

- Background in SaaS, marketplaces, job platforms, or B2B service companies preferred.

- Track record of improving organic traffic and rankings significantly.



Important:

IF YOU DO NOT MEET THE MINIMUM 5 YEARS, PLEASE DO NOT APPLY FOR NOW.

We do not check job boards regularly. Please send your complete application to 

to ensure it is reviewed.

title: Video Editor
description:
Job Description

We are seeking a proactive, organised, and reliable Video Editor to join our growing property development and investment business. This role is pivotal to how we communicate, build trust, and maintain momentum across our platforms, while also offering the opportunity to contribute to a purpose beyond the business.



As part of your responsibilities, you will primarily support Syntix Properties by reviewing footage, editing short- and long-form content in line with brand guidelines and the content schedule, creating thumbnails, preparing content for weekly review meetings, and scheduling and posting across TikTok, Meta, YouTube, and LinkedIn. You will also monitor trends, support the creation and performance tracking of ads, and report insights and recommendations to the wider team.



In addition to supporting the property business, you will occasionally edit and produce footage for NXT-GEN, helping to communicate Kingdom-focused messages and support the spreading of the gospel through high-quality, engaging content.



This is a purpose-driven role suited to someone who is creative, consistent, and dependable, with a strong eye for detail and a passion for using their editing skills to support both business growth and Kingdom impact.



Why This Role is Crucial

The role of Video Editor within our organisation is both strategic and highly valued. It sits at the heart of how Syntix Properties is seen, understood, and trusted by the market. By transforming raw footage and updates into clear, high-quality content, you help communicate our ethos of transparency, integrity, and excellence, while keeping our audience consistently informed and engaged.



Your work is crucial because our content directly supports the core drivers of the business: ABS/ABR, relationship building, and investor confidence. Every reel, long-form video, thumbnail, and post is an opportunity to show who we are, what we do, and how we operate, turning our projects, knowledge, and personal stories into a repeatable system that attracts deals, partners, and investors. When the content is consistent, on-brand, and delivered on schedule, it maintains momentum, strengthens credibility, and helps the wider team execute business objectives effectively.



What sets this role apart is its dual focus. While your primary output supports the property development business, you will also occasionally edit and produce footage for NXT-GEN. This aspect of the role allows you to use your creative skillset to support a Kingdom-focused mission, helping to communicate messages that contribute to the spreading of the gospel and creating lasting spiritual impact.



In this capacity, you enable leaders and the wider team to stay focused on high-level priorities, confident that our message is being delivered with clarity and professionalism across TikTok, Meta, YouTube, and LinkedIn. Your contribution plays a direct role in building trust, expanding our network, and supporting sustainable growth, ensuring that the standard of our public output matches the standard we uphold in our work, and supporting a purpose that goes beyond profit.



Property Development Business Support (50%) + Christian Organisation Support (50%)



Content Intake: Review raw content uploaded to Dropbox and confirm files are complete, usable, and labelled correctly.

Editing (Short + Long Form): Edit videos into short- and long-form formats in line with brand guidelines and the content schedule.

Thumbnails: Create and upload thumbnails for both short- and long-form content, consistent with brand identity.

Review Meeting Prep: Ensure all content is edited and ready for the “Schedule Content Review” meeting.

Scheduling & Posting: Schedule and post content across TikTok, Meta, YouTube, and LinkedIn, ensuring correct captions, hashtags, and timings.

Trend Monitoring: Assess trends across platforms and communicate relevant insights and opportunities to the team.

Paid Ads: Create, run, and monitor ads across platforms, adjusting creatives and targeting as needed.

Performance Reporting: Review performance of content, posts, and ads; gather data and provide recommendations to the wider team.



Benefits of the Role

Competitive Salary: A strong base salary reflective of your experience, skills, and the value you bring to both our business and ministry operations.

Performance-Based Bonuses: Receive a bonus for every successful property acquisition, rewarding your direct contribution to the growth and success of the company.

Team with Vision: Work alongside individuals who are passionate, focused, and aligned around a clear, purpose-driven vision.

Opportunity to transition into full-time



About Syntix Properties 

Syntix Properties is a dynamic property development company with a passion for breathing new life into tired and overlooked buildings. We specialise in turning neglected buildings into modern, affordable living spaces that meet the needs of today’s tenants. We aim to make property investment accessible and rewarding, while delivering high-quality, life-changing homes in partnership with trusted investors. We operate with transparency, integrity, and excellence in everything we build and manage.



Our Expectation: 

As a Video Editor within our organisation, you will be expected to embody and uphold the core values that define our culture and guide our work. We are committed to excellence in all that we do, and we seek team members who reflect that same standard. The following expectations are central to your success in this role:

Pursuit of Excellence: Approach every edit, thumbnail, caption, post, and ad creative big or small,  with a mindset of excellence. We value individuals who are proactive, detail-oriented, and committed to producing high-quality content that reflects the professionalism of our organisation.

Client-Focused Mindset: Whether creating content for investors, partners, prospective clients, ministry audiences, or internal stakeholders, you are expected to maintain a service-oriented approach that prioritises the needs of those we serve and communicates clearly and responsibly.

Integrity and Transparency: Act with honesty and integrity at all times. We believe in accurate representation of our work, open communication, clear reporting on performance, and ethical conduct as the foundation for trust across both business and ministry content.

Responsiveness and Reliability: Be timely and dependable in all communications and commitments. Prompt turnaround on revisions, consistent delivery against the content schedule, and reliable posting are key to maintaining momentum and strong relationships across both areas of your work.

Ownership and Accountability: Take full responsibility for the end-to-end content pipeline from reviewing raw footage to delivering final edits, scheduling posts, and reporting performance, demonstrating initiative and follow-through with minimal supervision.

Mission-Driven Alignment: Recognise the significance of your role in both business and ministry contexts. We expect a genuine commitment to the dual nature of this role, supporting commercial growth through consistent, high-quality content while occasionally contributing to NXT-GEN and the advancement of our Christian mission.





Required Skills

Video Editing Expertise: Advanced ability to edit short- and long-form content to a high standard (pacing, storytelling, sound design, captions, colour correction, graphics) with a strong understanding of platform-first editing.

Platform Knowledge (Growth Focused): Deep understanding of what performs on TikTok, Instagram/Meta, YouTube (shorts + long-form) and LinkedIn, including hooks, retention, watch time, formats, and audience behaviour.

Content Strategy & Repurposing: Ability to turn raw footage into multiple high-performing assets (reels/shorts, long-form, clips, teasers) while staying aligned with brand guidelines and content schedule.

Thumbnail & Creative Design: Strong skills in designing high-converting thumbnails and on-screen graphics that match brand identity and improve click-through rates.

Time Management & Delivery Excellence: Proven ability to hit deadlines consistently, manage multiple edits at once, and deliver content ready for review ahead of the “Schedule Content Review” meeting.

Attention to Detail & Brand Consistency: Strong eye for detail to ensure every edit, caption, visual, and post aligns with the company’s brand identity, tone, and standards of excellence.

Analytics & Performance Reporting: Ability to review performance of posts and ads, interpret data (retention, CTR, engagement, conversions), and provide clear recommendations to improve results.

Innovation & Trend Awareness: Proactive in identifying trends, formats, and creative angles across platforms, testing new ideas, and sharing insights that drive growth and engagement.

Ad Creative & Optimization: Confident in creating, running, and monitoring paid ads, including iterating creatives based on performance and communicating results to the team.

Technical Proficiency: Comfortable with professional editing tools (e.g., CapCut), motion graphics basics, file management, exporting specs, and working with Dropbox and scheduling tools.

Communication & Collaboration: Clear, professional communication with the team; able to receive feedback well, ask the right questions, and implement revisions quickly.

Reliability & Ownership: Takes full ownership of the content pipeline from footage review to final delivery, scheduling, and performance review without needing constant follow-up.

Team Fit & Professionalism: Positive, solutions-focused attitude; respectful, adaptable, and able to work well within a fast-moving team environment.

Alignment with Mission: Supportive of the company’s values and comfortable occasionally producing content for NXT-GEN that contributes to Kingdom-focused work and the spreading of the gospel.

Values: Aligns with the vision and mission of the business, demonstrating integrity, professionalism, and a commitment to excellence.

title: Operations & Office Manager
description:
Operations & Office Manager



Vantage Group

Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term Leadership Opportunity

About Vantage Group

Vantage Group is a structured, systems-driven facilities management platform serving complex commercial and multifamily real estate portfolios across the United States.

We partner with owners and operators who require:

- Operational clarity

- Vendor accountability

- Structured execution

- Measurable performance

We are not a traditional property management company.

We operate as the centralized execution and accountability layer between ownership and service providers.

Vantage is being built as a long-term, scalable operating platform with institutional-level structure and discipline.

This is an opportunity to join at an early but serious stage of growth.



Position Overview

We are seeking a highly organized, systems-oriented Operations & Office Manager to oversee and coordinate the internal execution engine of Vantage Group.

This is a leadership-level remote role responsible for ensuring alignment, accountability, and performance across multiple departments, including:

- Commercial (Estimating & Contracts)

- Vendor Network Development

- Strategic Development (Outbound Sales)

Account Operations

You will not be performing all of these roles.

You will ensure they are operating efficiently, accurately, and within defined systems.

This role requires independent judgment, professional maturity, and the ability to manage cross-functional execution remotely.



Mission of the Role

The Operations & Office Manager exists to ensure that Vantage operates through systems, not memory.

Your mandate is simple:

Ensure the internal machine runs predictably, measurably, and without chaos.

When workflows stall, standards drift, or communication gaps appear, you identify and resolve them within the system.



Preferred Background & Experience

Candidates with experience in the following roles will be strongly considered:

- Office Manager for a Property Management Company

- Operations Manager for a Facilities Management Company

- Operations Manager in a Commercial Landscaping or Field Services Company

- Director of Operations (B2B Service Business)

- Portfolio Operations Manager (Commercial Real Estate)

- Vendor Compliance or Vendor Relations Manager

- Contract Administration Manager (Service-Based Business)

- Service Operations or Dispatch Manager (Multi-Location Operations)

- Construction Project Coordinator (Commercial Projects)

- Executive Assistant to a CEO in a Structured, Operations-Driven Business



Key Responsibilities

1. Cross-Departmental Operational Oversight

- Monitor workflow movement between departments

- Ensure proposals, contracts, vendor onboarding, and account setups are completed on schedule

- Identify and resolve bottlenecks

- Maintain clear execution visibility across teams

- Escalate issues only when necessary



2. Sales & Pipeline Governance

- Maintain CRM accuracy and pipeline integrity

- Track opportunity progression and time-in-stage

- Ensure qualification standards are enforced

- Confirm clean handoffs from sales to operations

- Prevent unqualified opportunities from entering execution



3. Commercial & Contract Oversight

- Monitor proposal turnaround times

- Ensure contracts align with pricing and margin guardrails
